quest.name: 蘇る古の武器（ウイユヴェール）
journal: Gerolt has the air of a man defeated.

Gerolt has reluctantly agreed to lend his expertise to the restoration of a legendary arm of yore. For the first step, the weaponsmith bids you venture to the Sylphlands in the East Shroud to retrieve the Veil of Wiyu. Search for a vessel in which the valuable relic might be kept.
You have obtained the timeworn Veil of Wiyu. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and present the relic to Gerolt.

According to Gerolt, the restoration process involves merging the old with the new─that is, embedding the original relic in a new host weapon. To this end, you must bring him an erudite's picatrix of casting melded with two grade three savage might materia.

You have delivered the materia-enhanced erudite's picatrix of casting to Gerolt. The weaponsmith next directs you to go to the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and obtain alumina salts from the dhorme chimera.

※The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
※This objective must be completed as a summoner.
You have painstakingly obtained the pinch of alumina salts. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and deliver it to Gerolt.

Using the alumina salts you brought him, Gerolt adds the finishing touches to your relic weapon. Even as he declares his work over, however, the man believes that there is still something incomplete about it. In order to shed light upon the mystery, Gerolt suggests that you seek out literature surrounding the hero associated with the relic. Perhaps the trader Rowena back at Revenant's Toll will be able to assist you in this endeavor.

You have consulted Rowena, who agrees to procure the literature you seek...for a price. For your part of the deal, you must obtain for her an Amdapor glyph. Make your way through Amdapor Keep in the South Shroud, and procure this artifact.

※Amdapor Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a summoner.
You have successfully obtained an Amdapor glyph. Make your way back to Revenant's Toll and deliver it to Rowena.

You give the Amdapor glyph to Rowena, who upholds her promise and furnishes you a copy of Under the Veil. You now possess literature on the hero who once wielded the relic weapon. Gerolt the weaponsmith will be keen to peruse it.

After a cursory examination of the text, Gerolt declares that he will require some time to make sense of its contents. In the meantime, you are to familiarize yourself with the restored weapon in its current state. Arm yourself with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu, make your way to the Sylphlands in the East Shroud, and there slay eight sylpheed snarls, eight sylpheed sighs, and eight sylpheed screeches.
You have defeated the specified sylphs. Return to Hyrstmill and report your success to Gerolt.

Upon your return, Gerolt deduces that you must face mightier adversaries if you are to experience a revelation pertaining to your relic. To this end, he bids you challenge the hydra within Halatali, the abandoned training grounds situated in eastern Thanalan. Armed with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu, enter Halatali and defeat the hydra.

※The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
You have overcome the hydra. Take word of your accomplishment back to Gerolt at Hyrstmill.
Combining information gleaned from the text with your firsthand experience, Gerolt has ascertained what must be done next. Hand over the unfinished Veil of Wiyu to the weaponsmith.

Gerolt declares that but one step remains in the restoration. In order to create the raging fire that he needs, the weaponsmith bids you fetch him a white-hot ember, a howling gale, and a chunk of hyperfused ore. The first of these can be obtained by defeating Ifrit within the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

※The Bowl of Embers can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a summoner.

You have extinguished the Lord of the Inferno and obtained a white-hot ember. Next, take on Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard) and defeat her to obtain a howling gale.

※The Howling Eye can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a summoner.

You have silenced the Lady of the Vortex and obtained a howling gale. Next, take on Titan in the Navel (Hard) and defeat him to obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore.

※The Navel can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a summoner.
You have buried the Lord of Crags and obtained a chunk of hyperfused ore. Deliver it along with the white-hot ember and the howling gale to Gerolt.

You have delivered the three items Gerolt requires to create a raging fire. Now he only wants for a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to complete the restoration of your relic. Obtain this item and deliver it to the weaponsmith.

You have delivered the bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt, who promptly sees to the final stage of the restoration process. After no small amount of effort and perseverance, you are now the proud owner of the Veil of Wiyu. May it serve you well in your adventures to come!
objectives: Obtain the timeworn Veil of Wiyu from a treasure coffer in the Sylphlands.
Deliver the timeworn Veil of Wiyu to Gerolt.
Deliver a materia-enhanced erudite's picatrix of casting to Gerolt.
Examine the destination at the Weeping Saint and, as a summoner, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera.”
Deliver the alumina salts to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain an Amdapor glyph by completing Amdapor Keep as a summoner.
Deliver the Amdapor glyph to Rowena.
Deliver the copy of Under the Veil to Gerolt.
Slay sylpheed snarls while equipped with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu.
Slay sylpheed sighs while equipped with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu.
Slay sylpheed screeches while equipped with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu.
Speak with Gerolt.
Examine the destination outside Halatali and, with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu equipped, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra.”
Speak with Gerolt.
Give the unfinished Veil of Wiyu to Gerolt.
Obtain a white-hot ember in the Bowl of Embers (Hard) as a summoner.
Obtain a howling gale in the Howling Eye (Hard) as a summoner.
Obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore in the Navel (Hard) as a summoner.
Deliver the requested items to Gerolt.
Deliver a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out of me forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' it might be as ye've got that godsdamned slip of paper, but it'll only get ye so much. Restorin' relics like these calls for some rare ol' materials, an' I ain't got none. So if you want the job done, ye'll have to run along an' fetch 'em for me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So, what is it ye want restored?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Did I hear ye rightly? Yer sayin' that you revived the long-lost Allagan art o' summonin'? Bloody hells, I'd always thought 'twas naught but a myth...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If it's as ye say, the tales I heard growin' up might well have some truth to 'em. In particular, the one about the maiden Wiyu springs to mind. 'Twas the most detailed among 'em, ye see.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She was a right ravishin' lass, this Wiyu, with bright, green eyes an' a fiery spirit to match. Alas, she goes on to meet a premature end.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Accordin' to the tale, she an' her comrades square off against Odin, the Dark Divinity. When the battle takes an ill turn, she sacrifices herself to save her party. Right tragic, I know.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now, the encounter s'posedly took place in the Sylphlands, over in the East Shroud.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Assumin' there's any truth to the tale, might be as the grimoire used by Wiyu's still lyin' out there somewhere. To be sure, the Allagan Empire's three eras gone, but there ain't no harm in takin' a look, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If summoners're real as ye say, the tales I heard growin' up might well have some truth to 'em. In particular, the one about the maiden Wiyu springs to mind. 'Twas the most detailed among 'em, ye see.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She was a right ravishin' lass, this Wiyu, with bright, green eyes an' a fiery spirit to match. Alas, she goes on to meet a premature end.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Accordin' to the tale, she an' her comrades square off against Odin, the Dark Divinity. When the battle takes an ill turn, she sacrifices herself to save her party. Right tragic, I know.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now, the encounter s'posedly took place in the Sylphlands, over in the East Shroud. Assumin' there's any truth to the tale, might be as the grimoire used by Wiyu's still lyin' out there somewhere. To be sure, the Allagan Empire's three eras gone, but there ain't no harm in takin' a look, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, bugger me... Never in me wildest, drunkest dreams did I imagine ye'd actually find the bloody thing... Bah, so I'll have to fire up the forge, after all.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' said that, the relic's in far worse shape than I thought. It ain't like to survive much poundin' in this state. Truth be told, I'd be worried about sneezin' near it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> We're gonna need a new host what'll give itself for the restoration.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bring me an erudite's picatrix of casting, one with two grade three savage might materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, that's two grade three savage might materia. Aught less, an' ye'll get naught from me, no matter how many slips of paper ye wave in me face.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye need to bring me an erudite's picatrix of casting, one with two grade three savage might materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hm? Aye, I could hammer one out in me sleep, but then I could wipe yer arse without much trouble, an' I ain't plannin' on doin' that neither! Seems ye'll jus' have to do both yerself, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis a fine base ye've brought me. Aye, jus' the thing to host yer relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've merged what was left of the relic with the host weapon, so the groundwork's done. But don't go jumpin' for joy jus' yet─there's still more to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need to work on the finishin' touches, but due to the reinforcement work I've had to do, the book's provin' rather stubborn to mend.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To get 'round this, we'll be needin' some alumina salts, a substance made by grindin' a rock called alumina into fine grains. Unlucky for ye, though, it ain't easy to get hold of.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mayhap ye already know this, but there's beasties out there what devour their prey whole. An' some of 'em swallow rocks so as to aid with digestion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera what terrorizes the central highlands o' Coerthas happens to swallow alumina salts for this purpose.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the bugger an' bring me the alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a summoner.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
Jus' a dozen more kettles, then it's off to the tav─
You again!? What in the seven hells do ye want this time!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forgotten what to bring, eh? Gods' sake, womanman, ye've got the memory of a bleedin' whatsit!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the dhorme chimera an' bring me alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a summoner.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...An' o' course, the adventurer comes back triumphant. <sigh> Should've bloody known not even the chimera would be able to put ye out o' me misery.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hand over those alumina salts, an' I'll get right to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. I've squeezed out every onze of me skill to restore yer weapon, an' I think ye'll agree it looks the part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yet there's summat...missin' somehow, though I'm buggered if I know what. The piece jus' lacks a certain glow, as it were.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We need to learn more about the relic. Literature surroundin' the hero associated with it would be a fine place to begin...but I ain't exactly a scholarly an' haven't the slightest inklin' where to get me hands on such stuff.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As much as I hate to say this, Rowena's probably the one to talk to. Thing is, I'd sooner shove hot kettles up me arse sideways than owe that thrice-damned harridan another debt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer gonna have to make yerself useful once again. Take yerself to Rowena an' ask for her help, an' return here once ye've learned summat what might be of use.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're lookin' a bit more run-down than before. Your dealin's with Gerolt takin' their toll? Actually, forget I even asked. My mouth tastes o' bile if I so much as think o' that sorry specimen. So, is there somethin' you need?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Literature on the hero of old who once wielded your weapon?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hm, I reckon I can find what you need. Might take a bit o' time, is all.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: 'Course, this ain't a charity I'm runnin' here. I can get you what you want, but you'll have to do likewise for me.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll track down literature on Wiyu, the summoner maiden o' legend.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: For your part, you're to bring me an Amdapor glyph. You'll find this inside Amdapor Keep, a ruined castle situated in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Clear on the deal? Then run along and fulfill your part of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good on youlad! This is exactly what I was after. You've honored your part o' the bargain, and so I'll do the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back to pester me so soon? Judgin' from that smirk on yer face, I take it ye've found what ye need?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this text is about Wiyu, all right. But gods, would it have killed the bugger that wrote it to use normal bloody words!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll take me bleedin' moons to get through this lot─time I could be spendin' on kettles! Gah...while I try to make head or tail of it all, why don't ye take this here unfinished Veil o' Wiyu an' try it out?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, it's still missin' summat, but it's all there shape-wise, meanin' it should serve ye jus' fine as an ordinary weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as yer a ripe ol' summoner, mayhap ye'll be able to feel out exactly what it wants for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as Wiyu herself must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sylphlands over in the East Shroud oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some sylpheed sighs, snarls, an' screeches─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With the information in the text an' yer firsthand experience, I reckon we'll solve this puzzle yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I want ye to get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as Wiyu herself must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sylphlands over in the East Shroud oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some sylpheed sighs, snarls, an' screeches─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back already? By the frown yer wearin', I take it ye've got nothin' to show for yer time with the sylphs.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmmm, might be as ye want for better sport. An' I know jus' the creature what'll give it to ye─the hydra what reigns over the fiends within Halatali. A nasty piece of work, that. Try not to piss yer britches when ye see it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated by the entrance to Halatali in eastern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra” must be completed while equipped with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu.

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: We Immortal Flames have managed to cull most of the feral denizens of Halatali, but the hydra still remains. Frankly, we're out of our─

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to face the fell creature!? To be sure, we would be grateful if you could rid us of it, but I must warn you of the dangers. Survival is not guaranteed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to challenge the hydra, you must be equipped with the unfinished Veil of Wiyu.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hells, not ye again! Can't a man have a moment's bleedin' rest!? I've barely had time to piss since you gave me that damnable text.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Readin' the thing's given me a fierce bloody headache...which yer makin' worse by houndin' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do me a favor an' make yerself scarce, will ye? Go an' play with yer bloody Veil o' Wiyu or summat.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer... Yer still alive! Why the hells do you adventurers have to be so godsdamned sturdy!? I was bloody sure ye'd be hydra dung by now... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But what's done is done...or in this case, not done. Anyroad, let's talk about that text ye brought. It contains the many trials an' tribulations of our green-eyed heroine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye might expect, the tome tells ye a fuller story than ye'd get from yer grandmama. Thankfully, one o' the chapters happens to describe Wiyu's grimoire in detail.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I thought that the studs what adorn it were only good for holdin' the bloody thing together. But it turns out they're meant to channel the wielder's aether as well. Ye learn summat new every day, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, it should be easy enough to replace the studs with summat more suitable for the job.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye can see, I've done me research. I trust ye've also been pullin' yer weight, puttin' the relic to use like I said. Well, go on, then─tell me what ye've learned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is that so? Aye...I'd wondered about that.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. That leaves us with one last step.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That is, fully mergin' the old relic, the new host, an' the soul of the bearer─aye, that's you. Only then can the weapon be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But to do this, I need a fire what's hotter than the seventh hell. An' to keep such a fire alive an' ragin', I need a wind what's fiercer than the...than the...er, hangover I had last week. Gah, ye know what I mean!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon! Ah, an' I need me a bottle o' Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil as well to cool it off!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In order to restore yer weapon to its former glory, we need to fully merge the relic with the new host. Oh, aye─an' yer soul. Don't worry, though─it might not hurt much.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk of hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer back... Never doubted for a second ye'd trounce all three primals an' come back to pester me again.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All right, then, let's see the white-hot ember, the howling gale, an' the hyperfused ore.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these oughta get me the levels o' heat I need. Which leaves just the Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil for coolin' things off afterwards. Ye've got that, too, I assume?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've done yer part, an' so I'll do mine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Watch now, an' try not to bat yer eyelids─ain't every day ye get to see a relic reborn!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Muahahaha... MUAHAHAHAHAHA! These gods-given hands've worked yet another miracle! Feast yer eyes on the Veil o' Wiyu, jus' as it was in days of yore! 'Tis a sight to move a man to tears...ye lucky bastard. Ye'd better bloody well take care of it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to gain access to Amdapor Keep, you must complete the quest “Ghosts of Amdapor.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Bowl of Embers (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Howling Eye (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Howling Eye (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Navel (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Navel (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that you can only undertake one “A Relic Reborn” quest at any given time. If you wish to acquire a different relic weapon, you must either complete or abandon the current quest.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the dhorme chimera!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the hydra!

quest.name: 蘇る古の武器（マダレムジエン）
journal: Gerolt has the air of a man defeated.

Gerolt has reluctantly agreed to lend his expertise to the restoration of a legendary arm of yore. For the first step, the weaponsmith bids you venture to the Sapsa Spawning Grounds in western La Noscea to retrieve a copy of the Omnilex. Search for a vessel in which the valuable relic might be kept.
You have obtained a timeworn copy of the Omnilex. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and present the relic to Gerolt.

According to Gerolt, the restoration process involves merging the old with the new─that is, embedding the original relic in a new host weapon. To this end, you must bring him an erudite's picatrix of healing melded with two grade three quicktongue materia.

You have delivered the materia-enhanced erudite's picatrix of healing to Gerolt. The weaponsmith next directs you to go to the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and obtain alumina salts from the dhorme chimera.

※The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
※This objective must be completed as a scholar.
You have painstakingly obtained the pinch of alumina salts. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and deliver it to Gerolt.

Using the alumina salts you brought him, Gerolt adds the finishing touches to your relic weapon. Even as he declares his work over, however, the man believes that there is still something incomplete about it. In order to shed light upon the mystery, Gerolt suggests that you seek out literature surrounding the heroes associated with the relic. Perhaps the trader Rowena back at Revenant's Toll will be able to assist you in this endeavor.

You have consulted Rowena, who agrees to procure the literature you seek...for a price. For your part of the deal, you must obtain for her an Amdapor glyph. Make your way through Amdapor Keep in the South Shroud, and procure this artifact.

※Amdapor Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a scholar.
You have successfully obtained an Amdapor glyph. Make your way back to Revenant's Toll and deliver it to Rowena.

You give the Amdapor glyph to Rowena, who upholds her promise and furnishes you a copy of War of the Magi. You now possess literature on the heroes who once wielded the relic weapon. Gerolt the weaponsmith will be keen to peruse it.

After a cursory examination of the text, Gerolt declares that he will require some time to make sense of its contents. In the meantime, you are to familiarize yourself with the restored weapon in its current state. Arm yourself with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex, make your way to the Sapsa Spawning Grounds in western La Noscea, and there slay eight Sapsa shelfspine, eight Sapsa shelfclaw, and eight Sapsa shelftooth.
You have defeated the specified Sahagin. Return to Hyrstmill and report your success to Gerolt.

Upon your return, Gerolt deduces that you must face mightier adversaries if you are to experience a revelation pertaining to your relic. To this end, he bids you challenge the hydra within Halatali, the abandoned training grounds situated in eastern Thanalan. Armed with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex, enter Halatali and defeat the hydra.

※The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
You have overcome the hydra. Take word of your accomplishment back to Gerolt at Hyrstmill.
Combining information gleaned from the text with your firsthand experience, Gerolt has ascertained what must be done next. Hand over the unfinished copy of the Omnilex to the weaponsmith.

Gerolt declares that but one step remains in the restoration. In order to create the raging fire that he needs, the weaponsmith bids you fetch him a white-hot ember, a howling gale, and a chunk of hyperfused ore. The first of these can be obtained by defeating Ifrit within the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

※The Bowl of Embers (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a scholar.

You have extinguished the Lord of the Inferno and obtained a white-hot ember. Next, take on Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard) and defeat her to obtain a howling gale.

※The Howling Eye (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a scholar.

You have silenced the Lady of the Vortex and obtained a howling gale. Next, take on Titan in the Navel (Hard) and defeat him to obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore.

※The Navel (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a scholar.
You have buried the Lord of Crags and obtained a chunk of hyperfused ore. Deliver it along with the white-hot ember and the howling gale to Gerolt.

You have delivered the three items Gerolt requires to create a raging fire. Now he only wants for a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to complete the restoration of your relic. Obtain this item and deliver it to the weaponsmith.

You have delivered the bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt, who promptly sees to the final stage of the restoration process. After no small amount of effort and perseverance, you are now the proud owner of a copy of the Omnilex. May it serve you well in your adventures to come!
objectives: Obtain a timeworn copy of the Omnilex from a treasure coffer in the Sapsa Spawning Grounds.
Deliver the timeworn copy of the Omnilex to Gerolt.
Deliver a materia-enhanced erudite's picatrix of healing to Gerolt.
Examine the destination at the Weeping Saint and, as a scholar, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera.”
Deliver the alumina salts to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain an Amdapor glyph by completing Amdapor Keep as a scholar.
Deliver the Amdapor glyph to Rowena.
Deliver the copy of War of the Magi to Gerolt.
Slay Sapsa shelfspine while equipped with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex.
Slay Sapsa shelfclaw while equipped with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex.
Slay Sapsa shelftooth while equipped with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex.
Speak with Gerolt.
Examine the destination outside Halatali and, with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex equipped, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra.”
Speak with Gerolt.
Give the unfinished copy of the Omnilex to Gerolt.
Obtain a white-hot ember in the Bowl of Embers (Hard) as a scholar.
Obtain a howling gale in the Howling Eye (Hard) as a scholar.
Obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore in the Navel (Hard) as a scholar.
Deliver the requested items to Gerolt.
Deliver a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out of me forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' it might be as ye've got that godsdamned slip of paper, but it'll only get ye so much. Restorin' relics like these calls for some rare ol' materials, an' I ain't got none. So if you want the job done, ye'll have to run along an' fetch 'em for me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So, what is it ye want restored?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fancy yerself a scholar, eh? Like one o' them as helped the nation o' Nym preserve its sovereignty durin' the War o' the Magi way back when? I know a bit about 'em, as it happens.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: They were a right clever lot, those scholars. Thanks to their brilliant strategizin', the Nymians never failed to throw back would-be conquerors no matter how badly they were outnumbered. Like I always say, it ain't the size what matters, but how ye use it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A-Ahem! Aaanyroad, 'tis a copy o' the Omnilex ye want, a right bleedin' rare grimoire what's supposed to contain all the military tactics ever conceived by man.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Unlucky for ye, though, they don't make 'em like they used to. Which is to say, not anymore. But if yer heart's set on a copy, ye might try rootin' about western La Noscea.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If I remember rightly, the Nymians used to have a port over there, but it's long since become a Sahagin lair─the Sapsa Spawnin' Grounds, 'tis called.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Tis a copy o' the Omnilex ye want, a right bleedin' rare grimoire what's supposed to contain all the military tactics ever conceived by man.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Unlucky for ye, though, they don't make 'em like they used to. Which is to say, not anymore. But if yer heart's set on a copy, ye might try rootin' about western La Noscea.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If I remember rightly, the Nymians used to have a port over there, but it's long since become a Sahagin lair─the Sapsa Spawnin' Grounds, 'tis called.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, bugger me... Never in me wildest, drunkest dreams did I imagine ye'd actually find the bloody thing... Bah, so I'll have to fire up the forge, after all.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' said that, the relic's in far worse shape than I thought. It ain't like to survive much poundin' in this state. Truth be told, I'd be worried about sneezin' near it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> We're gonna need a new host what'll give itself for the restoration.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bring me an erudite's picatrix of healing, one with two grade three quicktongue materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, that's two grade three quicktongue materia. Aught less, an' ye'll get naught from me, no matter how many slips of paper ye wave in me face.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye need to bring me an erudite's picatrix of healing, one with two grade three quicktongue materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hm? Aye, I could hammer one out in me sleep, but then I could wipe yer arse without much trouble, an' I ain't plannin' on doin' that neither! Seems ye'll jus' have to do both yerself, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis a fine base ye've brought me. Aye, jus' the thing to host yer relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've merged what was left of the relic with the host weapon, so the groundwork's done. But don't go jumpin' for joy jus' yet─there's still more to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need to work on the finishin' touches, but due to the reinforcement work I've had to do, the book's provin' rather stubborn to mend.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To get 'round this, we'll be needin' some alumina salts, a substance made by grindin' a rock called alumina into fine grains. Unlucky for ye, though, it ain't easy to get hold of.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mayhap ye already know this, but there's beasties out there what devour their prey whole. An' some of 'em swallow rocks so as to aid with digestion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera what terrorizes the central highlands o' Coerthas happens to swallow alumina salts for this purpose.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the bugger an' bring me the alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a scholar.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
Jus' a dozen more kettles, then it's off to the tav─
You again!? What in the seven hells do ye want this time!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forgotten what to bring, eh? Gods' sake, womanman, ye've got the memory of a bleedin' whatsit!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the dhorme chimera an' bring me alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a scholar.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...An' o' course, the adventurer comes back triumphant. <sigh> Should've bloody known not even the chimera would be able to put ye out o' me misery.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hand over those alumina salts, an' I'll get right to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. I've squeezed out every onze of me skill to restore yer weapon, an' I think ye'll agree it looks the part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yet there's summat...missin' somehow, though I'm buggered if I know what. The piece jus' lacks a certain glow, as it were.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We need to learn more about the relic. Literature surroundin' the heroes associated with it would be a fine place to begin...but I ain't exactly a scholarly an' haven't the slightest inklin' where to get me hands on such stuff.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As much as I hate to say this, Rowena's probably the one to talk to. Thing is, I'd sooner shove hot kettles up me arse sideways than owe that thrice-damned harridan another debt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer gonna have to make yerself useful once again. Take yerself to Rowena an' ask for her help, an' return here once ye've learned summat what might be of use.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're lookin' a bit more run-down than before. Your dealin's with Gerolt takin' their toll? Actually, forget I even asked. My mouth tastes o' bile if I so much as think o' that sorry specimen. So, is there somethin' you need?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Literature on the heroes of old who once wielded your weapon?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hm, I reckon I can find what you need. Might take a bit o' time, is all.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: 'Course, this ain't a charity I'm runnin' here. I can get you what you want, but you'll have to do likewise for me.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll track down literature on the military scholars of old.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: For your part, you're to bring me an Amdapor glyph. You'll find this inside Amdapor Keep, a ruined castle situated in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Clear on the deal? Then run along and fulfill your part of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good on youlad! This is exactly what I was after. You've honored your part o' the bargain, and so I'll do the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back to pester me so soon? Judgin' from that smirk on yer face, I take it ye've found what ye need?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this text is about the military scholars of old, all right. But gods, would it have killed the bugger that wrote it to use normal bloody words!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll take me bleedin' moons to get through this lot─time I could be spendin' on kettles! Gah...while I try to make head or tail of it all, why don't ye take this here unfinished Omnilex an' try it out?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, it's still missin' summat, but it's all there shape-wise, meanin' it should serve ye jus' fine as an ordinary weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as yer a ripe ol' scholar, mayhap ye'll be able to feel out exactly what it wants for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the scholars who went afore ye must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With the information in the text an' yer firsthand experience, I reckon we'll solve this puzzle yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I want ye to get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the scholars who went afore ye must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back already? By the frown yer wearin', I take it ye've got nothin' to show for yer time with the fishbacks.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmmm, might be as ye want for better sport. An' I know jus' the creature what'll give it to ye─the hydra what reigns over the fiends within Halatali. A nasty piece of work, that. Try not to piss yer britches when ye see it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated by the entrance to Halatali in eastern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra” must be completed while equipped with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex.

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: We Immortal Flames have managed to cull most of the feral denizens of Halatali, but the hydra still remains. Frankly, we're out of our─

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to face the fell creature!? To be sure, we would be grateful if you could rid us of it, but I must warn you of the dangers. Survival is not guaranteed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to challenge the hydra, you must be equipped with the unfinished copy of the Omnilex.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hells, not ye again! Can't a man have a moment's bleedin' rest!? I've barely had time to piss since you gave me that damnable text.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Readin' the thing's given me a fierce bloody headache...which yer makin' worse by houndin' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do me a favor an' make yerself scarce, will ye? Go an' play with yer bloody Omnilex or summat.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer... Yer still alive! Why the hells do you adventurers have to be so godsdamned sturdy!? I was bloody sure ye'd be hydra dung by now... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But what's done is done...or in this case, not done. Anyroad, let's talk about that text ye brought. It contains accounts o' the major clashes what took place durin' the War o' the Magi.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The entry on the Battle o' the Gods' Grip jumped out at me. This was when the Nymians took the Amdapori host by surprise as it made its beach landin'─takin' the siege to the besiegers, as it were.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As they're wont to do, the scholars played a key role in the victory, though that didn't interest me near as much as the passage what touched on the Omnilex.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Turns out the patterns on the cover are meant to improve the flow of aether from the wielder's hands. An' I'd thought 'em merely decorations. Ye learn summat new every day, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye can see, I've done me research. I trust ye've also been pullin' yer weight, puttin' the relic to use like I said. Well, go on, then─tell me what ye've learned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is that so? Aye...I'd wondered about that.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. That leaves us with one last step.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That is, fully mergin' the old relic, the new host, an' the soul of the bearer─aye, that's you. Only then can the weapon be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But to do this, I need a fire what's hotter than the seventh hell. An' to keep such a fire alive an' ragin', I need a wind what's fiercer than the...than the...er, hangover I had last week. Gah, ye know what I mean!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon! Ah, an' I need me a bottle o' Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil as well to cool it off!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In order to restore yer weapon to its former glory, we need to fully merge the relic with the new host. Oh, aye─an' yer soul. Don't worry, though─it might not hurt much.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk of hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer back... Never doubted for a second ye'd trounce all three primals an' come back to pester me again.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All right, then, let's see the white-hot ember, the howling gale, an' the hyperfused ore.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these oughta get me the levels o' heat I need. Which leaves just the Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil for coolin' things off afterwards. Ye've got that, too, I assume?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've done yer part, an' so I'll do mine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Watch now, an' try not to bat yer eyelids─ain't every day ye get to see a relic reborn!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Muahahaha... MUAHAHAHAHAHA! These gods-given hands've worked yet another miracle! Feast yer eyes on the Omnilex, jus' as it was in days of yore! 'Tis a sight to move a man to tears...ye lucky bastard. Ye'd better bloody well take care of it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to gain access to Amdapor Keep, you must complete the quest “Ghosts of Amdapor.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Bowl of Embers (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Howling Eye (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Howling Eye (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Navel (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Navel (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that you can only undertake one “A Relic Reborn” quest at any given time. If you wish to acquire a different relic weapon, you must either complete or abandon the current quest.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the dhorme chimera!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the hydra!

quest.name: 蘇る古の武器（吉光）
journal: Gerolt has the air of a man defeated.

Gerolt has reluctantly agreed to lend his expertise to the restoration of a legendary arm of yore. For the first step, the weaponsmith bids you venture to the Sapsa Spawning Grounds in western La Noscea to retrieve the pair of Yoshimitsu. Search for a vessel in which the valuable relic might be kept.
You have obtained the pair of timeworn Yoshimitsu. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and present the relic to Gerolt.

According to Gerolt, the restoration process involves merging the old with the new─that is, embedding the original relic in a new host weapon. To this end, you must bring him a pair of vamper's knives melded with two grade three heavens' eye materia.

You have delivered the pair of materia-enhanced vamper's knives to Gerolt. The weaponsmith next directs you to go to the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and obtain alumina salts from the dhorme chimera.

※The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
※This objective must be completed as a ninja.
You have painstakingly obtained the pinch of alumina salts. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and deliver it to Gerolt.

Using the alumina salts you brought him, Gerolt adds the finishing touches to your relic weapon. Even as he declares his work over, however, the man believes that there is still something incomplete about it. In order to shed light upon the mystery, Gerolt suggests that you seek out literature surrounding the hero associated with the relic. Perhaps the trader Rowena back at Revenant's Toll will be able to assist you in this endeavor.

You have consulted Rowena, who agrees to procure the literature you seek...for a price. For your part of the deal, you must obtain for her an Amdapor glyph. Make your way through Amdapor Keep in the South Shroud, and procure this artifact.

※Amdapor Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a ninja.
You have successfully obtained an Amdapor glyph. Make your way back to Revenant's Toll and deliver it to Rowena.

You give the Amdapor glyph to Rowena, who upholds her promise and furnishes you a copy of Shonin-ki. You now possess literature on the hero who once wielded the relic weapon. Gerolt the weaponsmith will be keen to peruse it.

After a cursory examination of the text, Gerolt declares that he will require some time to make sense of its contents. In the meantime, you are to familiarize yourself with the restored weapon in its current state. Arm yourself with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu, make your way to the Sapsa Spawning Grounds in western La Noscea, and there slay eight Sapsa shelfspines, eight Sapsa shelfclaws, and eight Sapsa shelfteeth.
You have defeated the specified Sahagin. Return to Hyrstmill and report your success to Gerolt.

Upon your return, Gerolt deduces that you must face mightier adversaries if you are to experience a revelation pertaining to your relic. To this end, he bids you challenge the hydra within Halatali, the abandoned training grounds situated in eastern Thanalan. Armed with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu, enter Halatali and defeat the hydra.

※The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
You have overcome the hydra. Take word of your accomplishment back to Gerolt at Hyrstmill.
Combining information gleaned from the text with your firsthand experience, Gerolt has ascertained what must be done next. Hand over the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu to the weaponsmith.

Gerolt declares that but one step remains in the restoration. In order to create the raging fire that he needs, the weaponsmith bids you fetch him a white-hot ember, a howling gale, and a chunk of hyperfused ore. The first of these can be obtained by defeating Ifrit within the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

※The Bowl of Embers (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a ninja.

You have extinguished the Lord of the Inferno and obtained a white-hot ember. Next, take on Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard) and defeat her to obtain a howling gale.

※The Howling Eye (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a ninja.

You have silenced the Lady of the Vortex and obtained a howling gale. Next, take on Titan in the Navel (Hard) and defeat him to obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore.

※The Navel (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a ninja.
You have buried the Lord of Crags and obtained a chunk of hyperfused ore. Deliver it along with the white-hot ember and the howling gale to Gerolt.

You have delivered the three items Gerolt requires to create a raging fire. Now he only wants for a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to complete the restoration of your relic. Obtain this item and deliver it to the weaponsmith.

You have delivered the bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt, who promptly sees to the final stage of the restoration process. After no small amount of effort and perseverance, you are now the proud owner of the Yoshimitsu. May they serve you well in your adventures to come!
objectives: Obtain the pair of timeworn Yoshimitsu from the banded chest in the Sapsa Spawning Grounds.
Deliver the pair of timeworn Yoshimitsu to Gerolt.
Deliver a pair of materia-enhanced vamper's knives to Gerolt.
As a ninja, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera.”
Deliver the alumina salts to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain an Amdapor glyph by completing Amdapor Keep as a ninja.
Deliver the Amdapor glyph to Rowena.
Deliver the copy of Shonin-ki to Gerolt.
Slay Sapsa shelfspine while equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.
Slay Sapsa shelfclaw while equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.
Slay Sapsa shelftooth while equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.
Speak with Gerolt.
Examine the destination outside Halatali and, with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu equipped, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra.”
Speak with Gerolt.
Give the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu to Gerolt.
Obtain a white-hot ember in the Bowl of Embers (Hard) as a ninja.
Obtain a howling gale in the Howling Eye (Hard) as a ninja.
Obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore in the Navel (Hard) as a ninja.
Deliver the requested items to Gerolt.
Deliver a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out o' me forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' it might be as ye've got that godsdamned slip o' paper, but it'll only get ye so much. Restorin' relics like these calls for some rare ol' materials, an' I ain't got none. So if you want the job done, ye'll have to run along an' fetch 'em for me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So, what is it ye want restored?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fancy yerself a ninja, eh? Well, drown me in wine an' call me a moogle─ye'll be wantin' a pair o' Yoshimitsu, then, won't ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's two tricksy pieces o' steel! I tell ye, only a few in Eorzea have even heard the name. A few more know that old rhyme about the bloke what forged them. Mayhap ye are among them? No? Ah, well, it goes somethin' like this...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
There once was a Far Eastern smitty,
Well versed in makin' blades pretty.
“Far thicker than most,”
O' his dagger he'd boast...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
And its thrust was well known in the city!
Hmmm... Might be the prick in that poem ain't the point o' no blade. Er, anyroad, the man forged fine steel what bears his name. Fact of it is, his daggers have graced the hands o' many a hero an' heir to a high house.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye know, Yoshimitsu daggers have been on me mind o' late. Down at the tavern, I heard somethin' about Lominsans raidin' a Garlean ship, an' plunderin' a pair o' blades from her hold. Seems the privateers lost their booty when they ran afoul o' the fishbacks, though.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now, the whole thing reeks o' grog─an' that oughta mean somethin' comin' from yours truly! But if there's an onze o' truth to the story, then yer daggers'll be somewhere in the Sapsa Spawning Grounds.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye know, Yoshimitsu daggers have been on me mind o' late. Down at the tavern, I heard somethin' about Lominsans raidin' a Garlean ship, an' plunderin' a pair o' blades from her hold. Seems the privateers lost their booty when they ran afoul o' the fishbacks, though.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now, the whole thing reeks o' grog─an' that oughta mean somethin' comin' from yours truly! But if there's an onze o' truth to the story, then yer daggers'll be somewhere in the Sapsa Spawning Grounds.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, bugger me... Never in me wildest, drunkest dreams did I imagine ye'd actually find the bloody things... Bah, so I'll have to fire up the forge, after all.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' said that, the relic's in far worse shape than I thought. It ain't like to survive much poundin' in this state. Truth be told, I'd be worried about sneezin' near it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> We're gonna need a new host what'll give itself for the restoration.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye need to bring me a pair o' vamper's knives, ones with two grade three heavens' eye materia melded to them. They'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, that's two grade three heavens' eye materia. Aught less, an' ye'll get naught from me, no matter how many slips o' paper ye wave in me face.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye need to bring me a pair o' vamper's knives, ones with two grade three heavens' eye materia melded to them. They'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hm? Aye, I could hammer some out in me sleep, but then I could wipe yer arse without much trouble, an' I ain't plannin' on doin' that neither! Seems ye'll jus' have to do both yerself, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis a fine base ye've brought me. Aye, jus' the thing to host yer relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've merged what was left o' the relic with the host weapon, so the groundwork's done. But don't go jumpin' for joy jus' yet─there's still more to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need to work on the finishin' touches, but due to the reinforcement work I've had to do, the weapon's provin' rather stubborn to shape.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To get 'round this, we'll be needin' some alumina salts, a substance made by grindin' a rock called alumina into fine grains. Unlucky for ye, though, it ain't easy to get hold of.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mayhap ye already know this, but there's beasties out there what devour their prey whole. An' some of 'em swallow rocks so as to aid with digestion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera what terrorizes the central highlands o' Coerthas happens to swallow alumina salts for this purpose.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the bugger an' bring me the alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a ninja.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
Jus' a dozen more kettles, then it's off to the tav─
You again!? What in the seven hells do ye want this time!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forgotten what to bring, eh? Gods' sake, womanman, ye've got the memory of a bleedin' whatsit!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the dhorme chimera an' bring me alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a ninja.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...An' o' course, the adventurer comes back triumphant. <sigh> Should've bloody known not even the chimera would be able to put ye out o' me misery.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hand over those alumina salts, an' I'll get right to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. I've squeezed out every onze o' me skill to restore yer weapon, an' I think ye'll agree it looks the part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yet there's summat...missin' somehow, though I'm buggered if I know what. The piece jus' lacks a certain glow, as it were.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We need to learn more about the relic. Literature surroundin' the hero associated with it would be a fine place to begin...but I ain't exactly a scholarly an' haven't the slightest inklin' where to get me hands on such stuff.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As much as I hate to say this, Rowena's probably the one to talk to. Thing is, I'd sooner shove hot kettles up me arse sideways than owe that thrice-damned harridan another debt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer gonna have to make yerself useful once again. Take yerself to Rowena an' ask for her help, an' return here once ye've learned summat what might be of use.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're lookin' a bit more run-down than before. Your dealin's with Gerolt takin' their toll? Actually, forget I even asked. My mouth tastes o' bile if I so much as think o' that sorry specimen. So, is there somethin' you need?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Literature on the hero of old who once wielded your weapon?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hm, I reckon I can find what you need. Might take a bit o' time, is all.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: 'Course, this ain't a charity I'm runnin' here. I can get you what you want, but you'll have to do likewise for me.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll track down literature on the ninjas o' the Far East.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: For your part, you're to bring me an Amdapor glyph. You'll find this inside Amdapor Keep, a ruined castle situated in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Clear on the deal? Then run along and fulfill your part of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good on youlad! This is exactly what I was after. You've honored your part of the bargain, and so I'll do the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back to pester me so soon? Judgin' from that smirk on yer face, I take it ye've found what ye need?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this text is about the ninjas o' the Far East, all right. But gods, would it have killed the bugger that wrote it to use normal bloody words!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll take me bleedin' moons to get through this lot─time I could be spendin' on kettles! Gah...while I try to make head or tail of it all, why don't ye take this here pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu an' try 'em out?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, they're still missin' summat, but they're all there shape-wise, meanin' they should serve ye jus' fine as an ordinary weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as yer a ripe ol' ninja, mayhap ye'll be able to feel out exactly what they want for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the ninjas o' the Far East must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With the information in the text an' yer firsthand experience, I reckon we'll solve this puzzle yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the ninjas o' the Far East must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back already? By the frown yer wearin', I take it ye've got nothin' to show for yer time with the fishbacks.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmmm, might be as ye want for better sport. An' I know jus' the creature what'll give it to ye─the hydra what reigns over the fiends within Halatali. A nasty piece o' work, that. Try not to piss yer britches when ye see it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated by the entrance to Halatali in eastern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra” must be completed while equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: We Immortal Flames have managed to cull most of the feral denizens of Halatali, but the hydra still remains. Frankly, we're out of our─

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to face the fell creature!? To be sure, we would be grateful if you could rid us of it, but I must warn you of the dangers. Survival is not guaranteed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to challenge the hydra, you must be equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hells, not ye again! Can't a man have a moment's bleedin' rest!? I've barely had time to piss since you gave me that damnable text.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Readin' the thing's given me a fierce bloody headache...which yer makin' worse by houndin' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do me a favor an' make yerself scarce, will ye? Go an' play with yer bloody Yoshimitsu or summat.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer... Yer still alive! Why the hells do you adventurers have to be so godsdamned sturdy!? I was bloody sure ye'd be hydra dung by now... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But what's done is done...or in this case, not done. Anyroad, let's talk about that text ye brought. It contains an account o' how a Far Eastern ninja named Sasuke brought ninjutsu to Doma.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems ninjutsu was invented in a land far to the east of Othard's shores─same isle as where Sasuke grew up. The bloke was the best ninja about, so he gets secret orders or summat to cross the sea, an' makes his way to Doma.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Life for the Doman commonfolk was shite back then, what with the starvin' an' the poverty. The worst, though, was the bleedin' tyrant what ruled the place! Well, bein' the charitable sort, what's Sasuke to do but teach the smallfolk ninjutsu so they can win back their freedom?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer man trains some ninjas, an' together they boot the ruler's royal arse off the throne, an' put a dagger in his back for good measure. Well, with the dynasty dead, yer ninjas go lookin' for the spoils o' victory. An' what should they find in the palace vaults? Aye, a pair o' Yoshimitsu!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
After that, the lot o' them headed to the outlands o' Doma to build a hidden village, so's to live as ninjas away from pryin' eyes. 'Tis there they wrote a bit on the Yoshimitsu, enough that I know now what's wrong. Seems the rhyme about the smitty ain't about his member's thickness:
The daggers themselves are too damned slim!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: See, the vamper's knives make a good host, an' what ye got now will slip 'twixt a man's ribs jus' fine. But Yoshimitsu were made o' folded steel what could pierce armor without shatterin' nor crumplin'. A thick blade─aye, that's what yer weapons are wantin' for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye can see, I've done me research. I trust ye've also been pullin' yer weight, puttin' the relic to use like I said. Well, go on, then─tell me what ye've learned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is that so? Aye...I'd wondered about that.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. That leaves us with one last step.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That is, fully mergin' the old relic, the new host, an' the soul o' the bearer─aye, that's you. Only then can the weapon be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But to do this, I need a fire what's hotter than the seventh hell. An' to keep such a fire alive an' ragin', I need a wind what's fiercer than the...than the...er, hangover I had last week. Gah, ye know what I mean!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon! Ah, an' I need me a bottle o' Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil as well to cool it off!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In order to restore yer weapon to its former glory, we need to fully merge the relic with the new host. Oh, aye─an' yer soul. Don't worry, though─it might not hurt much.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer back... Never doubted for a second ye'd trounce all three primals an' come back to pester me again.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All right, then, let's see the white-hot ember, the howling gale, an' the hyperfused ore.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these oughta get me the levels o' heat I need. Which leaves just the Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil for coolin' things off afterwards. Ye've got that, too, I assume?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've done yer part, an' so I'll do mine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Watch now, an' try not to bat yer eyelids─ain't every day ye get to see a relic reborn!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Muahahaha... MUAHAHAHAHAHA! These gods-given hands've worked yet another miracle! Feast yer eyes on Yoshimitsu, jus' as they were in days o' yore! 'Tis a sight to move a man to tears...ye lucky bastard. Ye'd better bloody well take care o' them!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to gain access to Amdapor Keep, you must complete the quest “Ghosts of Amdapor.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Bowl of Embers (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Howling Eye (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Howling Eye (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Navel (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Navel (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that you can only undertake one “A Relic Reborn” quest at any given time. If you wish to acquire a different relic weapon, you must either complete or abandon the current quest.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the dhorme chimera!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the hydra!

obj.n: ファファジョニ上等闘兵
