quest.name: 「レジスタンス・ウェポン」への記憶定着
journal:
Zlatan is ready to test the power of memories.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You consult Zlatan about the types of memories that would be ideal for strengthening your weapon's inscription. Considering the blades of Gunnhildr were originally forged in Bozja, he believes memories of battle from the southern front are a matter of course. Then, to add a personal touch, he suggests memories of battle from a memorable location from your past would be ideal. As for how many memories, he believes the task at hand calls for three varieties of memory, and twenty of each.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in the following locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

With the requisite memories in hand, you return to Gangos and hand them over to Gerolt, who wastes no time setting to work filling the encampment with the clangor of his hammer. The ringing soon halts, and he presents you with a newly forged weapon. As you take it into hand, the newfound power surging through it is unmistakable. Zlatan can only look on in wonder at Gerolt's work, but their revelry comes to an end when Rowena appears. She explains that the idea to use memories to enhance the Resistance weapons was hers. What's more, one of the materials needed to accomplish this─a rather expensive one, she claims─was purchased from her stores on the behalf of the Resistance. It remains to be seen what she will ask for in return for her wares, but for now you take satisfaction in knowing you are better armed for the fight against the Empire.
objectives: With Honorbound and TenacitySamsaraSkullrenderDreizackBrillianceIngrimmSoulscourgeEspiritusAkademosHoneshirazuLawmanWoebornSolsticeHoshikiriTalekeeperCrownsbladeEnchufla in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Right then. As we discussed with Master Gerolt, I would ask that you procure memories for your weapon.

dialogue.text: If I may be frank, it is quite a relief to know we needn't rely on Mistress Rowena for this endeavor. Fashioning weapons for the new Gunnhildr's Blades was taxing enough on our coffers.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Gods, I shudder to think what more she could demand as payment...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ahem, but I digress. Perhaps first we should consider what manner of memory would be suitable for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: They should be memories of battle of course, but... Hmmm. The weapons' lineage can be traced to Bozja, so perhaps memories of battle on the southern front would be ideal.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to add a personal touch, I should think a memorable battle from places in your past would do nicely.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By my estimates, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. When you've gathered what we need, we can consult Master Gerolt on how best to proceed.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another Resistance weapon? Then I hope you are prepared to procure more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. Whether you gather them from the southern front or another more memorable locale, I leave to your judgment.

objectives: With Honorbound and TenacitySamsaraSkullrenderDreizackBrillianceIngrimmSoulscourgeEspiritusAkademosHoneshirazuLawmanWoebornSolsticeHoshikiriTalekeeperCrownsbladeEnchufla in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “For Want of a Memory,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “For Want of a Memory,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “For Want of a Memory,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Right then. As we discussed with Master Gerolt, I would ask that you procure memories for your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I may be frank, it is quite a relief to know we needn't rely on Mistress Rowena for this endeavor. Fashioning weapons for the new Gunnhildr's Blades was taxing enough on our coffers.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Gods, I shudder to think what more she could demand as payment...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ahem, but I digress. Perhaps first we should consider what manner of memory would be suitable for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: They should be memories of battle of course, but... Hmmm. The weapons' lineage can be traced to Bozja, so perhaps memories of battle on the southern front would be ideal.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to add a personal touch, I should think a memorable battle from places in your past would do nicely.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By my estimates, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. When you've gathered what we need, we can consult Master Gerolt on how best to proceed.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another Resistance weapon? Then I hope you are prepared to procure more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. Whether you gather them from the southern front or another more memorable locale, I leave to your judgment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in specified locations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Memories of the dying can be found at FATEs in the following six locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Three varieties of memory should be more than enough, though we will require twenty of each to ensure our success.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in specified locations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Memories of the dying can be found at FATEs in the following six locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Were you able to acquire the necessary memories? Before we can do anything, I'll need you to unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt is ready to begin. If you have the necessary memories, that is.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us see what Master Gerolt has planned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this looks to be everythin'. Have to hand it to those soldiers, they had a lot to say about all those crystals and whatnot.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if this works as it should─and it will, seein' as I planned it─once the memories are extracted, their energies can be absorbed into the inscriptions and stabilized. At the very least, it should double the strength of the user's bond with the weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: My word! To think memories of battle could lend one such strength... Ahem. Shall we begin then, Master Gerolt?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Another weapon for the ol' forge, eh? All right, let's see what tricks I've left up me sleeves.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But say the word, Master Gerolt, and I shall assist you.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Sit tight, Forename. This shouldn't take long.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fine work, if I do say so meself. Fit to rekindle hope in the Resistance: [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine blade if I do say so meself. Fit to rekindle hope in the Resistance: [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget her twin, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Turned out better than I expected. To be honest, I was stumped at first, then it hit me like a keg of ale. Had to pull a few strings to get all the ingredients together, but it was worth it in the end, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon if I had to do it again, the inscriptions could be infused with even more memories if we wanted.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Your genius never ceases to amaze me, Master Gerolt. But if I may ask, what exactly did you mean by “pulling strings”?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)For a lazy drunkard like him? Naturally, it can only mean one thing.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And the idea didn't hit him like a keg of ale so much as my hand to the back of his slack-jawed head. He was supposed to be reportin' his progress, but he was practically in tears beggin' me for help.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Then the materials for the weapon were...from your stores?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Not all of them, no. Just one. After he stopped snivelin' and explained yer predicament, it called to mind a young lady in Idyllshire whose work required a special memory cloth, though I'd rather not go into the details o' why. As you can imagine, the stuff doesn't come cheap.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By the gods... More debt?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm sure Bajsaljen won't mind!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: So Gerolt came to me without consultin' the Resistance first? No surprises there.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: As much as I'd like to squeeze him for every gil he's worth, if the Resistance were to crumble at a time like this, it'd be bad for business. How about we make another deal?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Ever the businesswoman, I see. What did you have in mind?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Nothin' that'll place any further strain on your coffers, if that's what you were thinking. You'll see...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Would you look at that. Our luck's turnin' for the better. What do you suppose's got her in such a good mood?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask, for I suspect this yet bodes ill for the future of the Resistance...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But, I suppose it does us little good to bemoan troubles yet to come. Work on Blade Surname's weapon is complete. In the end, that is what matters.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For the sake of the Resistance, we must concentrate our efforts on further strengthening the Resistance weapons. Rowena will reveal her plans to us soon enough, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The power of the memories seems to have taken to the weapon, and the enchantment of the cloth is holdin'. I reckon it can stand to be refined further if need be.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: With every forging Master Gerolt leaves me in awe of his work. Sadly, that feeling is supplanted by confusion and frustration at his appalling work ethic.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But that is neither here nor there. When you believe you are ready to see your weapon strengthened further, pray do not hesitate to call on us. Take care, and stay safe on the battlefield.

obj.n: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.
objectives: Obtain bitter memoriesAugmented Honorbound and Augmented TenacityAugmented SamsaraAugmented SkullrenderAugmented DreizackAugmented BrillianceAugmented IngrimmAugmented SoulscourgeAugmented EspiritusAugmented AkademosAugmented HoneshirazuAugmented LawmanAugmented WoebornAugmented SolsticeAugmented HoshikiriAugmented TalekeeperAugmented CrownsbladeAugmented EnchuflaWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the bitter memories to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.
objectives: Obtain bitter memoriesAugmented Honorbound and Augmented TenacityAugmented SamsaraAugmented SkullrenderAugmented DreizackAugmented BrillianceAugmented IngrimmAugmented SoulscourgeAugmented EspiritusAugmented AkademosAugmented HoneshirazuAugmented LawmanAugmented WoebornAugmented SolsticeAugmented HoshikiriAugmented TalekeeperAugmented CrownsbladeAugmented EnchuflaWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the bitter memories to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA

dialogue.name: REGANA

dialogue.name: ZLATAN

dialogue.name: REGANA

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT

dialogue.name: ZLATAN

dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.
objectives: Obtain bitter memoriesAugmented Honorbound and Augmented TenacityAugmented SamsaraAugmented SkullrenderAugmented DreizackAugmented BrillianceAugmented IngrimmAugmented SoulscourgeAugmented EspiritusAugmented AkademosAugmented HoneshirazuAugmented LawmanAugmented WoebornAugmented SolsticeAugmented HoshikiriAugmented TalekeeperAugmented CrownsbladeAugmented EnchuflaWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the bitter memories to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT

dialogue.name: ZLATAN

With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.

dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.
objectives: Obtain bitter memoriesAugmented Honorbound and Augmented TenacityAugmented SamsaraAugmented SkullrenderAugmented DreizackAugmented BrillianceAugmented IngrimmAugmented SoulscourgeAugmented EspiritusAugmented AkademosAugmented HoneshirazuAugmented LawmanAugmented WoebornAugmented SolsticeAugmented HoshikiriAugmented TalekeeperAugmented CrownsbladeAugmented EnchuflaWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the bitter memories to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN

dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 形を変えし「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Zlatan is ready to see you on your way.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You consult Zlatan about what manner of memory would be ideal to further enhance your Resistance weapon, and he suggests those that come from battles of great peril, such as one might expect in a large-scale assault. He is confident fifteen such memories will suffice. Where they should be collected, however, he leaves to your judgment.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front, or by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

Gerolt has readied his forge for your return, and he is quick to begin working when you hand him the memories. With his customary flourishes of clanging and banging, your Resistance weapon is given new form, the energies emanating from it nearly palpable. Though he is quite satisfied with his work, he believes there is yet room for improvement. It is his hope inspiration will strike again before you next call on his services.
objectives: Obtain loathsome memories of the dyingHonorbound Recollection and Tenacity RecollectionSamsara RecollectionSkullrender RecollectionDreizack RecollectionBrilliance RecollectionIngrimm RecollectionSoulscourge RecollectionEspiritus RecollectionAkademos RecollectionHoneshirazu RecollectionLawman RecollectionWoeborn RecollectionSolstice RecollectionHoshikiri RecollectionTalekeeper RecollectionCrownsblade RecollectionEnchufla RecollectionWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the loathsome memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Change of Arms,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
