dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Irresistible,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: This new variety of crystals was first discovered on the plateaus of Zadnor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Much like the memories of the dying, we believe these crystals manifested from pitched battle with the enemy where emotions ran high.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For a warrior of your prowess, I can only assume this means you must seek out perilous battles with the most deadly of foes to stir such emotions. We believe that fifteen of these crystallized emotions should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Seeking to refine another Resistance weapon, I see. Thankfully, there are still resources left over from the last weapon, though we will require another assortment of raw emotions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need fifteen to see our work done.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by undertaking the duties Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask where exactly you plan to procure the emotions we require, but I pray that you will return to us safely, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Blade Surname. If you have obtained a suitable store of raw emotions, let us commence the refining process. Before we begin, might I ask you to unequip your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has made ready the forge, and all the other requisite materials are accounted for. May I see the crystals you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us take these to Master Gerolt. I can scarcely wait to see what wonders he will work with his forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this seems to be everythin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Time to get to work. Why don't you go and tell the node what tickles yer fancy while I start in on the weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of the Allagan node, Regana, a sealant was required when we last made use of it. Will we not have need of more?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Yes, a sealant made with aetherial siltstone is still required to complete the refining process.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: However, when making adjustments to the node and testing the enhanced coating process, there was a surprising amount of sealant left unused. There should be enough for now, but if Forename should be inclined to refine other weapons, we will need to acquire more.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's awful kind o' ye. Maybe you ain't such a skinflint after all.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, it is in everyone's best interests to see these weapons perfected. And if the House of Splendors is to establish good relations with the Resistance, a constant cutthroat approach to business will get us nowhere.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That don't sound like the House o' Splendors I know, but if you've a mind to throw the Resistance a bone, who am I to argue?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, let's get to it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And you needn't worry about the aetherial sealant─I have already seen to its preparation. It is the least I can do after my previous transgressions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That is incredibly generous of you, Regana. Thank you.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, well... Generosity aside, there are material concerns that must be addressed if our work is to continue. Should you wish to make further alterations to the weapon, I'm afraid you will have to supply your own sealant.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon receptacle ready for aetheroinsulation coating application. Please select desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may raise four attributes associated with your Resistance weapon as you see fit. When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, that'll do. And that Allagan node did a mighty fine job on the finishin' touches.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A weapon truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A blade truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er twin, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The queen's inscription ain't never shined so bright as when I hammered them crystals into the Resistance weapon. Can scarcely imagine what went into the makin' o' Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' come face-to-face with Her Majesty yerself, I suppose you'd know better than any of us how potent the power o' memory an' emotions can be, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' now that selfsame power is coursin' through yer Resistance weapon. I reckon even Queen Gunnhildr herself'd be hard-pressed to draw any more power out o' them inscriptions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The way you describe it, one might think this Resistance weapon rivals the strength of Save the Queen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, Zlatan! That she might!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wha... What did you just call me?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Surely I'm not the only one who heard that. My actual name... Oh, I pray this is not merely a fleeting moment of sobriety.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's his name!? I s'pose it was only a matter a time afore I got it right...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But anyway, let's not get carried away with celebratin' just yet. We still have to share the fruits of our labor with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Yes, of course! I will go and inform him at once.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And I will see our contract to its conclusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I swear, if me kettles shined half as bright as these Resistance weapons, me debts'd be paid in no time at all.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt, I would rather you refrained from drawing comparisons between the legacy of my forebears and...kettles, no matter how shiny they may be.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Just a bit o' humor to keep the mood light, nothin' to get worked up about Laz─er, lad.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No harm done, Master Gerolt. If no offense was meant, then none shall be taken.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I fear he hasn't realized Gerolt has already forgotten his name.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Thank you for using the House of Splendor's weapon refinement services. <blip> <blip>
We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.

dialogue.text: Aye, that'll do. And that Allagan node did a mighty fine job on the finishin' touches.

dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A weapon truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er twin, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The queen's inscription ain't never shined so bright as when I hammered them crystals into the Resistance weapon. Can scarcely imagine what went into the makin' o' Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' come face-to-face with Her Majesty yerself, I suppose you'd know better than any of us how potent the power o' memory an' emotions can be, eh?

dialogue.text: Surely I'm not the only one who heard that. My actual name... Oh, I pray this is not merely a fleeting moment of sobriety.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's his name!? I s'pose it was only a matter a time afore I got it right...

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I fear he hasn't realized Gerolt has already forgotten his name.

dialogue.text:
Thank you for using the House of Splendor's weapon refinement services. <blip> <blip>
We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.

quest.name: 真の「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Before the finishing touches can be added to the Resistance weapon, Zlatan has one last task for you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

As Zlatan explains it, the raw emotions you seek were first discovered at the site of intense battles where emotions ran high. He asks that you seek out equally fierce confrontations to find fifteen crystals of raw emotion.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada in Zadnor, any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

You return to Gangos with the required raw emotions, and it is not long before the familiar clangor of Gerolt's hammer and the whirring of the Allagan node fills the air. Before long, the work is completed, and you find yourself the proud owner of a weapon the ancient Bozjans could only dream of, possessed of a strength that may very well rival that of Save the Queen. Zlatan wastes no time relaying the good news to Bajsaljen.

Interrupting the jubilant mood, Regana brings up the matter of their contract, claiming Rowena has doubled the asking price for the materials used in the forging of such weapons. To everyone's surprise, Rowena herself appears unexpectedly to refute those selfsame claims and thereby uncover Regana's extortion scheme. Her plans exposed, Regana fully expects her employment to be terminated, but Zlatan insists she stays on to fulfill the contract between the Resistance and the House of Splendors. Rowena consents to his request, and all present, save perhaps Gerolt, are pleased to see that their work will be allowed to continue.

Your work to perfect the Resistance weapon has enheartened Bajsaljen, for now the people of Bozja will at last have a shining beacon of hope under which they might rally.

Before the finishing touches can be added to the Resistance weapon, Zlatan has one last task for you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

As Zlatan explains it, the raw emotions you seek were first discovered at the site of intense battles where emotions ran high. He asks that you seek out equally fierce confrontations to find fifteen crystals of raw emotion.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You return to Gangos with the required raw emotions, and it is not long before the familiar clangor of Gerolt's hammer and the whirring of the Allagan node fills the air. Before long, the work is completed, and you find yourself the proud owner of a weapon the ancient Bozjans could only dream of, possessed of a strength that may very well rival that of Save the Queen. Zlatan wastes no time relaying the good news to Bajsaljen.

Interrupting the jubilant mood, Regana brings up the matter of their contract, claiming Rowena has doubled the asking price for the materials used in the forging of such weapons. To everyone's surprise, Rowena herself appears unexpectedly to refute those selfsame claims and thereby uncover Regana's extortion scheme. Her plans exposed, Regana fully expects her employment to be terminated, but Zlatan insists she stays on to fulfill the contract between the Resistance and the House of Splendors. Rowena consents to his request, and all present, save perhaps Gerolt, are pleased to see that their work will be allowed to continue.

Your work to perfect the Resistance weapon has enheartened Bajsaljen, for now the people of Bozja will at last have a shining beacon of hope under which they might rally.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: This new variety of crystals was first discovered on the plateaus of Zadnor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Much like the memories of the dying, we believe these crystals manifested from pitched battle with the enemy where emotions ran high.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For a warrior of your prowess, I can only assume this means you must seek out perilous battles with the most deadly of foes to stir such emotions. We believe that fifteen of these crystallized emotions should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Seeking to refine another Resistance weapon, I see. Thankfully, there are still resources left over from the last weapon, though we will require another assortment of raw emotions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need fifteen to see our work done.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by undertaking the duties Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask where exactly you plan to procure the emotions we require, but I pray that you will return to us safely, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Blade Surname. If you have obtained a suitable store of raw emotions, let us commence the refining process. Before we begin, might I ask you to unequip your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has made ready the forge, and all the other requisite materials are accounted for. May I see the crystals you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us take these to Master Gerolt. I can scarcely wait to see what wonders he will work with his forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this seems to be everythin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Time to get to work. Why don't you go and tell the node what tickles yer fancy while I start in on the weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of the Allagan node, Regana, a sealant was required when we last made use of it. Will we not have need of more?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Yes, a sealant made with aetherial siltstone is still required to complete the refining process.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: However, when making adjustments to the node and testing the enhanced coating process, there was a surprising amount of sealant left unused. There should be enough for now, but if Forename should be inclined to refine other weapons, we will need to acquire more.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's awful kind o' ye. Maybe you ain't such a skinflint after all.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, it is in everyone's best interests to see these weapons perfected. And if the House of Splendors is to establish good relations with the Resistance, a constant cutthroat approach to business will get us nowhere.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That don't sound like the House o' Splendors I know, but if you've a mind to throw the Resistance a bone, who am I to argue?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, let's get to it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And you needn't worry about the aetherial sealant─I have already seen to its preparation. It is the least I can do after my previous transgressions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That is incredibly generous of you, Regana. Thank you.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, well... Generosity aside, there are material concerns that must be addressed if our work is to continue. Should you wish to make further alterations to the weapon, I'm afraid you will have to supply your own sealant.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon receptacle ready for aetheroinsulation coating application. Please select desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may raise four attributes associated with your Resistance weapon as you see fit. When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, that'll do. And that Allagan node did a mighty fine job on the finishin' touches.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A weapon truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A blade truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er twin, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The queen's inscription ain't never shined so bright as when I hammered them crystals into the Resistance weapon. Can scarcely imagine what went into the makin' o' Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' come face-to-face with Her Majesty yerself, I suppose you'd know better than any of us how potent the power o' memory an' emotions can be, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' now that selfsame power is coursin' through yer Resistance weapon. I reckon even Queen Gunnhildr herself'd be hard-pressed to draw any more power out o' them inscriptions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The way you describe it, one might think this Resistance weapon rivals the strength of Save the Queen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, Zlatan! That she might!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wha... What did you just call me?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Surely I'm not the only one who heard that. My actual name... Oh, I pray this is not merely a fleeting moment of sobriety.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's his name!? I s'pose it was only a matter a time afore I got it right...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But anyway, let's not get carried away with celebratin' just yet. We still have to share the fruits of our labor with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Yes, of course! I will go and inform him at once.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And I will see our contract to its conclusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I swear, if me kettles shined half as bright as these Resistance weapons, me debts'd be paid in no time at all.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt, I would rather you refrained from drawing comparisons between the legacy of my forebears and...kettles, no matter how shiny they may be.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Just a bit o' humor to keep the mood light, nothin' to get worked up about Laz─er, lad.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No harm done, Master Gerolt. If no offense was meant, then none shall be taken.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I fear he hasn't realized Gerolt has already forgotten his name.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Thank you for using the House of Splendor's weapon refinement services. <blip> <blip>
We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.

quest.name: 真の「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Before the finishing touches can be added to the Resistance weapon, Zlatan has one last task for you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

As Zlatan explains it, the raw emotions you seek were first discovered at the site of intense battles where emotions ran high. He asks that you seek out equally fierce confrontations to find fifteen crystals of raw emotion.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada in Zadnor, any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

You return to Gangos with the required raw emotions, and it is not long before the familiar clangor of Gerolt's hammer and the whirring of the Allagan node fills the air. Before long, the work is completed, and you find yourself the proud owner of a weapon the ancient Bozjans could only dream of, possessed of a strength that may very well rival that of Save the Queen. Zlatan wastes no time relaying the good news to Bajsaljen.

Interrupting the jubilant mood, Regana brings up the matter of their contract, claiming Rowena has doubled the asking price for the materials used in the forging of such weapons. To everyone's surprise, Rowena herself appears unexpectedly to refute those selfsame claims and thereby uncover Regana's extortion scheme. Her plans exposed, Regana fully expects her employment to be terminated, but Zlatan insists she stays on to fulfill the contract between the Resistance and the House of Splendors. Rowena consents to his request, and all present, save perhaps Gerolt, are pleased to see that their work will be allowed to continue.

Your work to perfect the Resistance weapon has enheartened Bajsaljen, for now the people of Bozja will at last have a shining beacon of hope under which they might rally.

We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.

quest.name: 蘇る古の武器（コルタナ）
journal: Gerolt has the air of a man defeated.

Gerolt has reluctantly agreed to lend his expertise to the restoration of a legendary arm of yore. For the first step, the weaponsmith bids you venture within Zahar'ak in southern Thanalan to retrieve the lost Curtana. Search for a vessel in which the valuable relic might be kept.
You have obtained the timeworn Curtana. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and present the relic to Gerolt.

According to Gerolt, the restoration process involves merging the old with the new─that is, embedding the original relic in a new host weapon. To this end, you must bring him an aeolian scimitar melded with two grade three battledance materia.

You have delivered the materia-enhanced aeolian scimitar to Gerolt. The weaponsmith next directs you to go to the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and obtain alumina salts from the dhorme chimera.

※The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
※This objective must be completed as a paladin.
You have painstakingly obtained the pinch of alumina salts. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and deliver it to Gerolt.

Using the alumina salts you brought him, Gerolt adds the finishing touches to your relic weapon. Even as he declares his work over, however, the man believes that there is still something incomplete about it. In order to shed light upon the mystery, Gerolt suggests that you seek out literature surrounding the hero associated with the relic. Perhaps the trader Rowena back at Revenant's Toll will be able to assist you in this endeavor.

You have consulted Rowena, who agrees to procure the literature you seek...for a price. For your part of the deal, you must obtain for her an Amdapor glyph. Make your way through Amdapor Keep in the South Shroud, and procure this artifact.

※Amdapor Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a paladin.
You have successfully obtained an Amdapor glyph. Make your way back to Revenant's Toll and deliver it to Rowena.

You give the Amdapor glyph to Rowena, who upholds her promise and furnishes you a copy of The Song of Tristram. You now possess literature on the hero who once wielded the relic weapon. Gerolt the weaponsmith will be keen to peruse it.

After a cursory examination of the text, Gerolt declares that he will require some time to make sense of its contents. In the meantime, you are to familiarize yourself with the restored weapon in its current state. Arm yourself with the unfinished Curtana, make your way to Zahar'ak in southern Thanalan, and there slay eight Zahar'ak lancers, eight Zahar'ak pugilists, and eight Zahar'ak thaumaturges.
You have defeated the specified Amalj'aa. Return to Hyrstmill and report your success to Gerolt.

Upon your return, Gerolt deduces that you must face mightier adversaries if you are to experience a revelation pertaining to your relic. To this end, he bids you challenge the hydra within Halatali, the abandoned training grounds situated in eastern Thanalan. Armed with the unfinished Curtana, enter Halatali and defeat the hydra.

※The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
You have overcome the hydra. Take word of your accomplishment back to Gerolt at Hyrstmill.
Combining information gleaned from the text with your firsthand experience, Gerolt has ascertained what must be done next. Hand over the unfinished Curtana to the weaponsmith.

Gerolt declares that but one step remains in the restoration. In order to create the raging fire that he needs, the weaponsmith bids you fetch him a white-hot ember, a howling gale, and a chunk of hyperfused ore. The first of these can be obtained by defeating Ifrit within the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

※The Bowl of Embers (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a paladin.

You have extinguished the Lord of the Inferno and obtained a white-hot ember. Next, take on Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard) and defeat her to obtain a howling gale.

※The Howling Eye (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a paladin.

You have silenced the Lady of the Vortex and obtained a howling gale. Next, take on Titan in the Navel (Hard) and defeat him to obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore.

※The Navel (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a paladin.
You have buried the Lord of Crags and obtained a chunk of hyperfused ore. Deliver it along with the white-hot ember and the howling gale to Gerolt.

You have delivered the three items Gerolt requires to create a raging fire. Now he only wants for a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to complete the restoration of your relic. Obtain this item and deliver it to the weaponsmith.

You have delivered the bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt, who promptly sees to the final stage of the restoration process. After no small amount of effort and perseverance, you are now the proud owner of Curtana. May it serve you well in your adventures to come!
objectives: Obtain the timeworn Curtana from a treasure coffer in Zahar'ak.
Deliver the timeworn Curtana to Gerolt.
Deliver a materia-enhanced aeolian scimitar to Gerolt.
Examine the destination at the Weeping Saint and, as a paladin, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera.”
Deliver the alumina salts to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain an Amdapor glyph by completing Amdapor Keep as a paladin.
Deliver the Amdapor glyph to Rowena.
Deliver the copy of The Song of Tristram to Gerolt.
Slay Zahar'ak lancers while equipped with the unfinished Curtana.
Slay Zahar'ak pugilists while equipped with the unfinished Curtana.
Slay Zahar'ak thaumaturges while equipped with the unfinished Curtana.
Speak with Gerolt.
Examine the destination outside Halatali and, with the unfinished Curtana equipped, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra.”
Speak with Gerolt.
Give the unfinished Curtana to Gerolt.
Obtain a white-hot ember in the Bowl of Embers (Hard) as a paladin.
Obtain a howling gale in the Howling Eye (Hard) as a paladin.
Obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore in the Navel (Hard) as a paladin.
Deliver the requested items to Gerolt.
Deliver a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out of me forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' it might be as ye've got that godsdamned slip of paper, but it'll only get ye so much. Restorin' relics like these calls for some rare ol' materials, an' I ain't got none. So if you want the job done, ye'll have to run along an' fetch 'em for me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So, what is it ye want restored?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fancy yerself a knight in shinin' armor, eh? Whatever floats yer boat, I s'pose...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, it's Curtana ye'll be wantin'. 'Twas the blade wielded by Jhal Tristram the True, one of the three first paladins.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Story goes that, when the first sultan of Ul'dah formed the Sultansworn, he had three swords forged from the same ore used to make Oathkeeper─one for each of his champions.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Curtana was one of the blades, an' it was laid to rest with its master when he kicked the bucket. Rumor has it, though, that Jhal Tristram's tomb was plundered recently, an' Curtana taken.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'd wager a flagon of mead it was them Amalj'aa what did the deed. Fair makes me blood boil imaginin' some filthy lizardman struttin' about Zahar'ak with such a fine blade.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, ye'll need to retrieve Curtana one way or another, though how ye go about it makes no odds to me. I fancy ye'll have to pry it from the hands of a dead Amalj'aa, though.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's Curtana ye'll be wantin'. 'Twas the blade wielded by Jhal Tristram the True, one of the three first paladins.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Story goes that, when the first sultan of Ul'dah formed the Sultansworn, he had three swords forged from the same ore used to make Oathkeeper─one for each of his champions.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Curtana was one of the blades, an' it was laid to rest with its master when he kicked the bucket. Rumor has it, though, that Jhal Tristram's tomb was plundered recently, an' Curtana taken.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'd wager a flagon of mead it was them Amalj'aa what did the deed. Fair makes me blood boil imaginin' some filthy lizardman struttin' about Zahar'ak with such a fine blade.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, ye'll need to retrieve Curtana one way or another, though how ye go about it makes no odds to me. I fancy ye'll have to pry it from the hands of a dead Amalj'aa, though.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, bugger me... Never in me wildest, drunkest dreams did I imagine ye'd actually find the bloody thing... Bah, so I'll have to fire up the forge, after all.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' said that, the relic's in far worse shape than I thought. It ain't like to survive much poundin' in this state. Truth be told, I'd be worried about sneezin' near it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> We're gonna need a new host what'll give itself for the restoration.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bring me an aeolian scimitar, one with two grade three battledance materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, that's two grade three battledance materia. Aught less, an' ye'll get naught from me, no matter how many slips of paper ye wave in me face.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye need to bring me an aeolian scimitar, one with two grade three battledance materia melded to it. This'll serve as the vessel for the restored relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hm? Aye, I could hammer one out in me sleep, but then I could wipe yer arse without much trouble, an' I ain't plannin' on doin' that neither! Seems ye'll jus' have to do both yerself, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis a fine base ye've brought me. Aye, jus' the thing to host yer relic.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've merged what was left of the relic with the host weapon, so the groundwork's done. But don't go jumpin' for joy jus' yet─there's still more to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need to work on the finishin' touches, but due to the reinforcement work I've had to do, the weapon's provin' rather stubborn to shape.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To get 'round this, we'll be needin' some alumina salts, a substance made by grindin' a rock called alumina into fine grains. Unlucky for ye, though, it ain't easy to get hold of.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mayhap ye already know this, but there's beasties out there what devour their prey whole. An' some of 'em swallow rocks so as to aid with digestion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera what terrorizes the central highlands o' Coerthas happens to swallow alumina salts for this purpose.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the bugger an' bring me the alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a paladin.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
Jus' a dozen more kettles, then it's off to the tav─
You again!? What in the seven hells do ye want this time!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forgotten what to bring, eh? Gods' sake, womanman, ye've got the memory of a bleedin' whatsit!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Slay the dhorme chimera an' bring me alumina salts, an' I'll see to the finishin' touches on yer weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated at the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera” must be completed as a paladin.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...An' o' course, the adventurer comes back triumphant. <sigh> Should've bloody known not even the chimera would be able to put ye out o' me misery.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hand over those alumina salts, an' I'll get right to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. I've squeezed out every onze of me skill to restore yer weapon, an' I think ye'll agree it looks the part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yet there's summat...missin' somehow, though I'm buggered if I know what. The piece jus' lacks a certain glow, as it were.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We need to learn more about the relic. Literature surroundin' the hero associated with it would be a fine place to begin...but I ain't exactly a scholarly an' haven't the slightest inklin' where to get me hands on such stuff.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As much as I hate to say this, Rowena's probably the one to talk to. Thing is, I'd sooner shove hot kettles up me arse sideways than owe that thrice-damned harridan another debt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer gonna have to make yerself useful once again. Take yerself to Rowena an' ask for her help, an' return here once ye've learned summat what might be of use.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're lookin' a bit more run-down than before. Your dealin's with Gerolt takin' their toll? Actually, forget I even asked. My mouth tastes o' bile if I so much as think o' that sorry specimen. So, is there somethin' you need?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Literature on the hero of old who once wielded your weapon?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hm, I reckon I can find what you need. Might take a bit o' time, is all.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: 'Course, this ain't a charity I'm runnin' here. I can get you what you want, but you'll have to do likewise for me.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll track down literature on Jhal Tristram the True.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: For your part, you're to bring me an Amdapor glyph. You'll find this inside Amdapor Keep, a ruined castle situated in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Clear on the deal? Then run along and fulfill your part of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good on youlad! This is exactly what I was after. You've honored your part o' the bargain, and so I'll do the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back to pester me so soon? Judgin' from that smirk on yer face, I take it ye've found what ye need?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this text is about Jhal Tristram, all right. But gods, would it have killed the bugger that wrote it to use normal bloody words!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll take me bleedin' moons to get through this lot─time I could be spendin' on kettles! Gah...while I try to make head or tail of it all, why don't ye take this here unfinished Curtana an' try it out?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, it's still missin' summat, but it's all there shape-wise, meanin' it should serve ye jus' fine as an ordinary weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as yer a ripe ol' paladin, mayhap ye'll be able to feel out exactly what it wants for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as Jhal Tristram himself must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Zahar'ak, the Amalj'aa stronghold over in southern Thanalan, oughta serve yer needs─aye, the same place ye found the sword. Pit yerself against some Zahar'ak lancers, pugilists, an' thaumaturges─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With the information in the text an' yer firsthand experience, I reckon we'll solve this puzzle yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I want ye to get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as Jhal Tristram himself must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Zahar'ak, the Amalj'aa stronghold over in southern Thanalan, oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Zahar'ak lancers, pugilists, an' thaumaturges─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back already? By the frown yer wearin', I take it ye've got nothin' to show for yer time with the lizardmen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmmm, might be as ye want for better sport. An' I know jus' the creature what'll give it to ye─the hydra what reigns over the fiends within Halatali. A nasty piece of work, that. Try not to piss yer britches when ye see it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated by the entrance to Halatali in eastern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra” must be completed while equipped with the unfinished Curtana.

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: We Immortal Flames have managed to cull most of the feral denizens of Halatali, but the hydra still remains. Frankly, we're out of our─

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to face the fell creature!? To be sure, we would be grateful if you could rid us of it, but I must warn you of the dangers. Survival is not guaranteed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to challenge the hydra, you must be equipped with the unfinished Curtana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hells, not ye again! Can't a man have a moment's bleedin' rest!? I've barely had time to piss since you gave me that damnable text.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Readin' the thing's given me a fierce bloody headache...which yer makin' worse by houndin' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do me a favor an' make yerself scarce, will ye? Go an' play with yer bloody Curtana or summat.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer... Yer still alive! Why the hells do you adventurers have to be so godsdamned sturdy!? I was bloody sure ye'd be hydra dung by now... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But what's done is done...or in this case, not done. Anyroad, let's talk about that text ye brought. It contains tales of Jhal Tristram's exploits. Turns out I already knew most of it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To give ye the gist of it: a young Tristram goes afore the sultan, he pledges him his sword, the Sultansworn are formed, Tristram defeats an Amalj'aa pugilist in a famous duel, then sets off on a quest to retrieve the Sacred Goblet...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Things get a bit fanciful from then on, but cuttin' a long story short, Curtana does get a mention.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Four crystals embedded in the guard an' the ashes of a saint in the hilt─these're the sword's secrets.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In the old days, it was common practice to forge a weapon usin' body parts. A bit morbid, I grant ye, but folk back then believed the spirits of the dead offered the bearer protection.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Unlucky fer ye, the relic's hilt was in 'specially bad shape. I tried to make do with only the host weapon's, but it seems it weren't enough. Ah, but never ye fear─with me bottomless well o' talent, I'll work somethin' out yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye can see, I've done me research. I trust ye've also been pullin' yer weight, puttin' the relic to use like I said. Well, go on, then─tell me what ye've learned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is that so? Aye...I'd wondered about that.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. That leaves us with one last step.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That is, fully mergin' the old relic, the new host, an' the soul of the bearer─aye, that's you. Only then can the weapon be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But to do this, I need a fire what's hotter than the seventh hell. An' to keep such a fire alive an' ragin', I need a wind what's fiercer than the...than the...er, hangover I had last week. Gah, ye know what I mean!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon! Ah, an' I need me a bottle o' Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil as well to cool it off!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In order to restore yer weapon to its former glory, we need to fully merge the relic with the new host. Oh, aye─an' yer soul. Don't worry, though─it might not hurt much.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk of hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer back... Never doubted for a second ye'd trounce all three primals an' come back to pester me again.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All right, then, let's see the white-hot ember, the howling gale, an' the hyperfused ore.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these oughta get me the levels o' heat I need. Which leaves just the Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil for coolin' things off afterwards. Ye've got that, too, I assume?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've done yer part, an' so I'll do mine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Watch now, an' try not to bat yer eyelids─ain't every day ye get to see a relic reborn!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Muahahaha... MUAHAHAHAHAHA! These gods-given hands've worked yet another miracle! Feast yer eyes on Curtana, jus' as it was in days of yore! 'Tis a sight to move a man to tears...ye lucky bastard. Ye'd better bloody well take care of it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to gain access to Amdapor Keep, you must complete the quest “Ghosts of Amdapor.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Bowl of Embers (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Howling Eye (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Howling Eye (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Navel (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Navel (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that you can only undertake one “A Relic Reborn” quest at any given time. If you wish to acquire a different relic weapon, you must either complete or abandon the current quest.

dialogue.text: Defeat the dhorme chimera!
