quest.name: 「グンヒルドの剣」の復刻
journal:
Gerolt looks ready to fire up his forge.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Thanks to your efforts and Cid's cooperation, everything is in place to begin reforging the blades of Gunnhildr, arms Gerolt would now refer to as Resistance weapons. Before setting to work, however, Gerolt asks you to expound on your exploration of Cid's mind. This insight makes clear to him that the weapons require a final ingredient before they can be completed─a special powder highly conductive to aether. Much to his dismay, the one best suited to acquiring this for you is none other than Rowena. At the risk of incurring more debt, he asks you to meet with her in Kugane to make an arrangement on behalf of the Bozjan Resistance.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Rowena has heard the details of your predicament from Gerolt, and is willing to provide you with the powder you require. It will, however, come at a cost to the Bozjan Resistance. You are unsure of what this means for Bajsaljen and his comrades, but the deal is struck nevertheless. With matters settled in Kugane, you return to Gangos, eager to see the fruits of Gerolt's labor.

Though you are too late to behold the masterful strikes of Gerolt's hammer on his anvil, you are fortunate enough to witness the final touches to the inscription. Armed as one of Gunnhildr's elite guard, you will soon be ready to help liberate the people of Bozja.
objectives: Wait for Rowena at the Umineko Teahouse in Kugane.
Deliver the Thavnairian scalepowder to Gerolt at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Forename Surname? I am Zlatan. It's an honor to meet you. I've not much experience with the forge, but it is my hope that I might improve working under Master Gerolt.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The first step in my training appears to be getting him to remember my name...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer here. Good. Ready to get workin' on the Resistance weapons, lasslad?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Fire in the Forge,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Gerolt again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye like the name, “Resistance weapon”?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It crossed me mind to call 'em Gunnhildr's blades, but after talkin' with Misija, we figured it'd be too confusin', seein' as that's also the name o' the queen's guard.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, yer timin' couldn't be better. Before we get to workin' in earnest, I was hopin' ye could tell me a bit more about what went on in Cid's noggin. I've heard a fair bit from Mikoto, but I'd like to know if you saw any different.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmm... Sounds like I was right to ask ye before settin' to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems to me those fancy markin's in the weapons are mainly for show. I can copy 'em, aye, but that won't be enough.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Like as not they were carved into the hilts as well. And to make sure the spell can take hold, ye'd need a finish with fine powder what's conductive to aether.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: For material like that, I reckon ye'd need to consult the alchemists o' Radz–at–Han... <sigh> And I can only think o' one person with close contacts there.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Rowena...?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Oh gods, you don't mean...?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, the demoness o' coin.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But not to worry, lasslad. It just so happens she's been keepin' up a steady shipment o' supplies here on contract. If we say we need the powder fer the Resistance, might be as we can convince her to waive the costs.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She ain't usually one to do business fer charity, I know, but it's worth a try, eh? I'll see about getting in touch with her, and after I do, you can go and meet with her an' figure out the rest.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well ye don't expect me to go and meet with her, do ye? Workin' on the Resistance weapons's kept me too busy by half, and Drake here─ Er, I mean... Uh... What was yer name again?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Zlatan, Master Gerolt. My name is Zlatan. But more importantly, what if Mistress Rowena doesn't agree to a charitable contribution to our cause?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm sure if you an' Bajsaljen ask her nicely she might come 'round. But never mind that─we've important work to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As fer where to find Rowena, afore she left Gangos, she said she'd be stoppin' over in Kugane on business. How's about I have her meet ye at the Umineko Teahouse? If we're lucky, a nice cup o' tea'll brighten her mood.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Afraid I'll have to leave Rowena to you, lasslad. Me tryin' to bargain with her'd be like squeezin' blood from a stone.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I fear Bajsaljen will not take well to Master Gerolt's plan. But I suppose it is for the sake of the Resistance...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)I was wonderin' when you'd show up. Gerolt told me everything.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And luckily for you, my business here was at the Thavnairian Consulate. Here you are. This should be enough powder for one of those Resistance weapons you're forgin'.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I've got to hand it to Gerolt. Seems he spends half his time getting deeper in debt, and the other half avoiding payment.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Fine by me, though. Thanks to his schemin' I've a little more leverage over the Resistance and, by extension, him as well.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Pass along a message to Gerolt and Bajsaljen for me, won't you? If they require more material for these weapons, I'd be more than happy to supply them. For a fee, of course.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Same goes for you. I know you adventurin' types are always lookin' to be prepared for any sort of encounter, so if you're thinkin' of forgin' another of these Resistance weapons─and I suspect you are─you know where to go.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll see to it my girls in Revenant's Toll and Idyllshire keep their shelves stocked. Until next time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It has long been our wish to see the blades of Gunnhildr reforged, and it is for that purpose Bajsaljen has agreed to covering the required expenses. I but pray we are ready when Mistress Rowena demands recompense.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The weapon's nearly finished, Forename. Just needs a nice coatin' with that powder to finish the inscription.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: O' course she bloody found what we needed. As much as I hate fattenin' her purse with another man's coin, least now we can do our part fer the Resistance.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on some of me finest work to date. Best of all, the inscription'll react to yer aether.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine weapon to rally the Bozjans: [???]. I reckon Gunnhildr'd be proud.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine sword an' shield to rally the Bozjans: [Error] and [Error]. I reckon Gunnhildr'd be proud.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That I should behold the glory of the fabled blades born anew... Hope is not yet lost.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All in a day's work for yer ol' pal Gerolt. 'Course, this is only the beginning.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Your skills with a hammer were truly a sight to behold, Master Gerolt. And to see Forename wielding one of their holy blades thus, it is as if I stand before one of the heroes of eld.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: When the time comes to do battle with the Empire, our brothers-in-arms will look upon you and know courage. On behalf of the Bozjan Resistance, I offer you my humblest thanks for your aid thus far.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'd love to start fresh on another weapon, but I had to use every last morsel o' the powder on that one.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Meaning we would find ourselves indebted further to Mistress Rowena were we to acquire more... I must consult Bajsaljen before we proceed further.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Looks like we're takin' a short break then, eh? If you find yourself wantin' for another weapon, though, come an' speak with me helper here.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think I've earned meself a nice, big flagon of ale tonight! To, uh...celebrate the forgin', o' course!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A repeatable quest is now available from Zlatan at Gangos. This quest may be accepted to create Resistance weapons for other jobs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, Thavnairian scalepowder can now be purchased from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

obj.n: シタデル・ボズヤ蒸発事変
新たな「レジスタンス・ウェポン」の製造

quest.name: 新たな「レジスタンス・ウェポン」の製造
journal: Zlatan is gravely concerned by the potential cost of forging additional Resistance weapons.

At the mention of forging additional Resistance weapons, Zlatan's expression turns to one of staggering guilt. Knowing their coffers cannot bear the weight of additional debt, he accedes to your request on the condition that you procure the required powder. How the deed is to be done, he leaves entirely to your discretion.

Through means perhaps better left unspoken, you acquire the requisite powder for Gerolt's work. Newly armed, he bids you set out into the world and hone your skills with this newly fashioned Resistance weapon. And when the time comes, he will help you to reach new heights of martial perfection.
objectives: Obtain Thavnairian scalepowderDeliver the Thavnairian scalepowder to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Resistance Is (Not) Futile,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You wish to forge another Resistance weapon? We do have a surplus of materials from the first, but there still remains the matter of the powder.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: When we first resolved to undertake the forging of these weapons, we understood it would come at considerable cost. But it is no exaggeration to say that a single weapon has greatly taxed our coffers.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It shames me to ask this after you have done so much for our cause, but... Might we prevail upon you to procure the powder on our behalf?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hopefully, acquiring the means to barter for additional powder shouldn't be too taxing a task for a worldly adventurer such as yourself.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You wish to forge another Resistance weapon? Oh dear...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It will take time, but we should be able to gather the required materials. Save for one... If you would be willing to acquire more powder, we will see to the rest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thavnairian scalepowder can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: My apologies for placing such a burden on you, but we simply cannot afford to accrue further debt from Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thavnairian scalepowder can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it you have paid visit to the House of Splendors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. I will have Master Gerolt set to work at once.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Linin' Rowena's pockets again... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Better your coin than the Bozjans' I suppose. If yer sure about this, we'll get to finishin' yer weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Some o' me best work, if I do say so meself. [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Some o' me best work, if I do say so meself. I call 'em [Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If what we've learned about the blades o' Gunnhildr is true, ye can make 'em stronger dependin' on what manner o' monster you felled with 'em. Should hold true for yers as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So once ye've put 'emher through theirher paces, come back an' I'll see about toughenin' 'emher up.

quest.name: 「レジスタンス・ウェポン」への記憶定着
journal:
Zlatan is ready to test the power of memories.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You consult Zlatan about the types of memories that would be ideal for strengthening your weapon's inscription. Considering the blades of Gunnhildr were originally forged in Bozja, he believes memories of battle from the southern front are a matter of course. Then, to add a personal touch, he suggests memories of battle from a memorable location from your past would be ideal. As for how many memories, he believes the task at hand calls for three varieties of memory, and twenty of each.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in the following locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

With the requisite memories in hand, you return to Gangos and hand them over to Gerolt, who wastes no time setting to work filling the encampment with the clangor of his hammer. The ringing soon halts, and he presents you with a newly forged weapon. As you take it into hand, the newfound power surging through it is unmistakable. Zlatan can only look on in wonder at Gerolt's work, but their revelry comes to an end when Rowena appears. She explains that the idea to use memories to enhance the Resistance weapons was hers. What's more, one of the materials needed to accomplish this─a rather expensive one, she claims─was purchased from her stores on the behalf of the Resistance. It remains to be seen what she will ask for in return for her wares, but for now you take satisfaction in knowing you are better armed for the fight against the Empire.
objectives: With Honorbound and TenacitySamsaraSkullrenderDreizackBrillianceIngrimmSoulscourgeEspiritusAkademosHoneshirazuLawmanWoebornSolsticeHoshikiriTalekeeperCrownsbladeEnchufla in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “For Want of a Memory,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “For Want of a Memory,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “For Want of a Memory,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Right then. As we discussed with Master Gerolt, I would ask that you procure memories for your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I may be frank, it is quite a relief to know we needn't rely on Mistress Rowena for this endeavor. Fashioning weapons for the new Gunnhildr's Blades was taxing enough on our coffers.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Gods, I shudder to think what more she could demand as payment...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ahem, but I digress. Perhaps first we should consider what manner of memory would be suitable for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: They should be memories of battle of course, but... Hmmm. The weapons' lineage can be traced to Bozja, so perhaps memories of battle on the southern front would be ideal.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to add a personal touch, I should think a memorable battle from places in your past would do nicely.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By my estimates, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. When you've gathered what we need, we can consult Master Gerolt on how best to proceed.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another Resistance weapon? Then I hope you are prepared to procure more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need three varieties of memory, and twenty of each. Whether you gather them from the southern front or another more memorable locale, I leave to your judgment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in specified locations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Memories of the dying can be found at FATEs in the following six locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Three varieties of memory should be more than enough, though we will require twenty of each to ensure our success.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the dying can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from specific FATEs in specified locations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Memories of the dying can be found at FATEs in the following six locations:
Coerthas Western Highlands, the Dravanian Forelands, the Dravanian Hinterlands, the Churning Mists, the Sea of Clouds, or Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Were you able to acquire the necessary memories? Before we can do anything, I'll need you to unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt is ready to begin. If you have the necessary memories, that is.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us see what Master Gerolt has planned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this looks to be everythin'. Have to hand it to those soldiers, they had a lot to say about all those crystals and whatnot.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if this works as it should─and it will, seein' as I planned it─once the memories are extracted, their energies can be absorbed into the inscriptions and stabilized. At the very least, it should double the strength of the user's bond with the weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: My word! To think memories of battle could lend one such strength... Ahem. Shall we begin then, Master Gerolt?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Another weapon for the ol' forge, eh? All right, let's see what tricks I've left up me sleeves.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But say the word, Master Gerolt, and I shall assist you.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Sit tight, Forename. This shouldn't take long.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fine work, if I do say so meself. Fit to rekindle hope in the Resistance: [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine blade if I do say so meself. Fit to rekindle hope in the Resistance: [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget her twin, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Turned out better than I expected. To be honest, I was stumped at first, then it hit me like a keg of ale. Had to pull a few strings to get all the ingredients together, but it was worth it in the end, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon if I had to do it again, the inscriptions could be infused with even more memories if we wanted.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Your genius never ceases to amaze me, Master Gerolt. But if I may ask, what exactly did you mean by “pulling strings”?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)For a lazy drunkard like him? Naturally, it can only mean one thing.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And the idea didn't hit him like a keg of ale so much as my hand to the back of his slack-jawed head. He was supposed to be reportin' his progress, but he was practically in tears beggin' me for help.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Then the materials for the weapon were...from your stores?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Not all of them, no. Just one. After he stopped snivelin' and explained yer predicament, it called to mind a young lady in Idyllshire whose work required a special memory cloth, though I'd rather not go into the details o' why. As you can imagine, the stuff doesn't come cheap.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By the gods... More debt?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm sure Bajsaljen won't mind!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: So Gerolt came to me without consultin' the Resistance first? No surprises there.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: As much as I'd like to squeeze him for every gil he's worth, if the Resistance were to crumble at a time like this, it'd be bad for business. How about we make another deal?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Ever the businesswoman, I see. What did you have in mind?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Nothin' that'll place any further strain on your coffers, if that's what you were thinking. You'll see...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Would you look at that. Our luck's turnin' for the better. What do you suppose's got her in such a good mood?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask, for I suspect this yet bodes ill for the future of the Resistance...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But, I suppose it does us little good to bemoan troubles yet to come. Work on Blade Surname's weapon is complete. In the end, that is what matters.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For the sake of the Resistance, we must concentrate our efforts on further strengthening the Resistance weapons. Rowena will reveal her plans to us soon enough, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The power of the memories seems to have taken to the weapon, and the enchantment of the cloth is holdin'. I reckon it can stand to be refined further if need be.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: With every forging Master Gerolt leaves me in awe of his work. Sadly, that feeling is supplanted by confusion and frustration at his appalling work ethic.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But that is neither here nor there. When you believe you are ready to see your weapon strengthened further, pray do not hesitate to call on us. Take care, and stay safe on the battlefield.

obj.n: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ

quest.name: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
journal:
Zlatan has a hopeful look in his eyes, as he understands your return can mean only one thing.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Eager to further strengthen your Resistance weapon, you consult Zlatan, who suggests you find another assortment of memories. Zlatan warns you, however, that the weapon will require much more potent memories if you expect to see any notable improvements. He then sends you on your way, certain the threat of imminent death will not deter you from seeing the job done.

※Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, by clearing any level 60 dungeon, or completing Duty Roulette: Leveling. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

You return to Gangos to find Gerolt surprisingly sober and ready to work. With his customary flourish and flair, Gerolt readies his forge, and before long you are the proud owner of a powerful new Resistance weapon. There is no time to celebrate, however, as an employee of Rowena soon arrives offering a means to pay for Gerolt's previous dealings with the House of Splendors. Matters of money aside, Zlatan prays for your continued success in the fight against the Empire.
objectives: Obtain bitter memoriesAugmented Honorbound and Augmented TenacityAugmented SamsaraAugmented SkullrenderAugmented DreizackAugmented BrillianceAugmented IngrimmAugmented SoulscourgeAugmented EspiritusAugmented AkademosAugmented HoneshirazuAugmented LawmanAugmented WoebornAugmented SolsticeAugmented HoshikiriAugmented TalekeeperAugmented CrownsbladeAugmented EnchuflaWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the bitter memories to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “The Will to Resist,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Will to Resist,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to further strengthen your weapon, I see. Then we shall have need of more memories.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Of course, if we wish to see any significant improvement, they will need to come from much fiercer battles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: But where to find them? I have no doubt the fighting on the southern front has grown more perilous, but what more is there to do? Journey in search of some dark, dreary dungeon teeming with unspeakable horrors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well... I suppose you have already come this far. Surely you understand your limits better than I. If you can procure six crystals of these grizzly, bitter memories, I believe that should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Eager to refine another of your weapons, I take it? Then you know what must be done.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Another six of your grizzliest bitter memories from the southern front or perhaps some other perilous place you may recall from your adventures.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can only imagine what horrors you will face to acquire the memories we need, but I wish you luck. Stay safe out there, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained in the field fighting at the southern front, or from certain dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Bitter memories can be obtained by clearing any level 60 dungeon or Duty Roulette: Leveling. Moreover, the Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned dungeons.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Only one bitter memory can be obtained via Duty Roulette: Leveling per day.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it your search for memories went well? If you are ready to begin, I would ask you unequip your weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I've kept my eye on Master Gerolt, and made sure he saw to preparations. I trust you have everything we need?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent! And the weapon, please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: All right, I pray Master Gerolt is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename! Your timin' couldn't be better! I've just <hic> sobered up!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hiding ale again!? But where could you have... <sigh> Never mind. Might we set to work, please?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye ever see anythin' so beautiful? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't she a beaut? The spirit of battle made manifest, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course, we can't forget her dazzlin' companion, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now if you'll excuse me, there's a mug of ale around here somewhere with me name on it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Slack-jawed, bald pate, and a thirst for spirits. I presume you are Gerolt, the famed blacksmith and squanderer of fortune?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Who in the bloody hell are you? And what've me money problems to do with anythin'?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look like yer part o' the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My name is Regana, and I am here on behalf of my employer, Rowena. I believe she spoke with you before of a means to alleviate the financial burden of the Resistance?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Come now, don't tell me you've forgotten already. Or did you believe she intended to supply you with that memory cloth free of charge?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rowena wishes to compile records of the various techniques used to reproduce the blades of Gunnhildr. Everything from the materials required down to the inscriptions granting them their power, she would have cataloged for our research.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: With these documents in hand, we would then fashion duplicates of any weapons you have made thus far, in addition to any forged henceforth.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The Resistance weapons are incredibly valuable, and key to the Resistance's victory in the war against the Empire. Bajsaljen would never allow it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Then I will collect the gil owed for Rowena's cloth, if that is your wont.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: If it puts your mind at ease, the duplicates are meant to resemble the originals in appearance only. We have no need to recreate the intricacies of the inscriptions or their aetherial properties.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I can't imagine the Resistance would be too happy about─

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will accept their offer. This may be the only way for us to keep Gunnhildr's Blades and our friend here armed to combat the Empire.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Though it's not as if you could refuse, Gerolt. Of course, you'd know that if you'd actually read your contract.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And to be clear, these replicas are strictly for purposes of research, yes? They will not be auctioned off to the lords and ladies of the realm for profit?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: You have our word we will not misuse the knowledge gained from this venture, and I will remain here in Gangos should you need to consult me regarding my work.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ah, one last thing. If Forename should have need of these replicas for any reason, I have been instructed to oblige as necessary. Now, if you will excuse me.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...don't believe she answered my question.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, whatever she's schemin', at least we won't see the worst of it till after we're done. Otherwise, I have a feelin' me work'd be tarnished with me own memories o' battle with gil-pinchin' harridans.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Replica Resistance weapons can now be purchased from Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think we're done here. Now, where did I put that flagon of ale?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it... Hidin' me drinks is gonna be tricky, what with Zlatan and Regana both breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Honestly, would it kill you to wait until after your obligations to Rowena are fulfilled to drink? If I catch you drinking around the forge again, it will be for the last time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Until next time, Forename. Rest assured we will keep eyes on him for as long as it takes to keep work proceeding apace.

quest.name: 形を変えし「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Zlatan is ready to see you on your way.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You consult Zlatan about what manner of memory would be ideal to further enhance your Resistance weapon, and he suggests those that come from battles of great peril, such as one might expect in a large-scale assault. He is confident fifteen such memories will suffice. Where they should be collected, however, he leaves to your judgment.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front, or by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

Gerolt has readied his forge for your return, and he is quick to begin working when you hand him the memories. With his customary flourishes of clanging and banging, your Resistance weapon is given new form, the energies emanating from it nearly palpable. Though he is quite satisfied with his work, he believes there is yet room for improvement. It is his hope inspiration will strike again before you next call on his services.
objectives: Obtain loathsome memories of the dyingHonorbound Recollection and Tenacity RecollectionSamsara RecollectionSkullrender RecollectionDreizack RecollectionBrilliance RecollectionIngrimm RecollectionSoulscourge RecollectionEspiritus RecollectionAkademos RecollectionHoneshirazu RecollectionLawman RecollectionWoeborn RecollectionSolstice RecollectionHoshikiri RecollectionTalekeeper RecollectionCrownsblade RecollectionEnchufla RecollectionWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the loathsome memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A2

dialogue.name: SYSTEM

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Change of Arms,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Change of Arms,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Are you ready to seek out memories for your weapon? Excellent.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We have come to the conclusion that those formed at a moment of great peril─such as some manner of large-scale assault─would best suit our purposes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Battles on the southern front will no doubt suffice, but I imagine a worldly adventurer such as yourself can think of other places to find them. If you can track down fifteen such memories, we should be well on our way to forging a new weapon for you.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to refine another Resistance weapon, I presume? Then I will have Master Gerolt ready the forge.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, the work will require another set of fifteen memories.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: With memories of sufficient intensity, we are quite certain no more than fifteen will be required for the task at hand. Where you choose to find them, be it on the southern front or elsewhere, I will leave to your judgment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Before we begin, might I ask you to remove your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has readied the forge, along with all other requisite materials. May I have the memories you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wonderful. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Very good. Master Gerolt will be delighted. Or whatever passes for delight in that ale-sodden mind of his.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, then. If these here memories are as potent as I think they are, this should make for interestin' work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to spruce up another Resistance weapon, are we? Well, can't rightly say no after ye went through the trouble o' gatherin' all these here memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, then. If these here memories are anythin' like the last bunch, this shouldn't take too long.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems the memories've taken to yer weapon well enough. And they've transformed it into a right fine piece of art. I call 'em'er, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems the memories've taken to yer weapon well enough. And they've transformed it into a right fine piece of art. I call 'er, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er counterpart, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Turns out the queen's inscriptions are more powerful than I gave 'em credit for. Wouldn't surprise me if they've a bit more untapped potential.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You have outdone yourself once again, Master Gerolt! Why, it is almost enough to overlook your deplorable drinking habits. And you believe the weapon may be improved upon even further?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can't say fer certain. Perhaps if, uh...if I were to take a little stroll about the camp─ye know, to clear me head an' such─might be as I'll be struck by inspiration.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Did you not say the very same thing shortly after Blade Surname left to collect memories? As I recall, it was a very short stroll to the storehouse. Where you imbibed the entirety of our last keg of ale...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No, I believe you've had enough inspiration for one day, Master Gerolt. Instead, I believe it behooves us to share your latest accomplishment with the others before promptly returning to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> Not even a pint for all me efforts. Well, don't let us keep you. I'm sure you're itchin' to try that fancy new weapon o' yers. If afterward ye decide it still needs more work, come back and I'll see what I can do.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As always, it is an honor and a privilege to see you work, Master Gerolt. It is quite clear there is still much for me to learn about the art of smithing.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer praise is appreciated, but what I need now ain't compliments, but mead. Or mayhaps if ye'd let me fix up a kettle or two fer a nice change o' pace...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is weapons the Resistance needs, Master Gerolt, not kettles. Surely, devising methods of improving the Resistance weapons would be a better use of your time?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, if you should find your weapon wants for refinement, do not hesitate to come and speak with me.

quest.name: 「レジスタンス・ウェポン」は新たな道を
journal:
Zlatan is ready to see you on your way once more.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

While relieved to know the Bozjan ruins are not the only place where antiquities made of aetherial siltstone may be found, Zlatan is no less discomfited knowing the arduous task of procuring them must fall to you. Gerolt is confident that fifteen relics should suffice for your plans, and so you set out in search of dark, perilous ruins, hoping his guess is on the mark.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

You return to Gangos with a hard-earned assortment of artifacts. Loaded into the Allagan node, along with the Resistance weapon, the refinement process thereafter is surprisingly painless. Almost suspiciously so. Zlatan and Gerolt then discuss the feasibility of repeating the refinement process, prompting an equally suspicious recording from the Allagan node, extolling wares from the House of Splendors that would save you the trouble of finding more artifacts, albeit at a price. Zlatan would not forbid you from purchasing from the House of Splendors, but he is understandably keen to avoid any unnecessary dealings with the notoriously unscrupulous Rowena.
objectives: Obtain timeworn artifactsLaw's Order Bastard Sword and Law's Order Kite ShieldLaw's Order KnucklesLaw's Order LabrysLaw's Order SpearLaw's Order Composite BowLaw's Order CaneLaw's Order RodLaw's Order IndexLaw's Order CodexLaw's Order KnivesLaw's Order RevolverLaw's Order ZweihanderLaw's Order AstrometerLaw's Order Samurai BladeLaw's Order RapierLaw's Order ManatriggerLaw's Order ChakramsWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the timeworn artifacts to the Allagan node at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Who would have thought that the answer to our prayers would be found in ancient pottery of all places?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And thanks to the efforts of merchants countless years ago, such relics may be found far beyond the region in which they originated. Considering the present state of Bozja, being able to search for them in other locations may prove beneficial to us.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I say “us,” but I am afraid the task of procuring them must fall unto you, Blade Surname. Though I dare not ask why, Master Gerolt is quite confident that fifteen artifacts made from aetherial siltstone are likely to contain the requisite amount to coat your Resistance weapon. I trust you know better than I what ruins are worthy of exploration, so I will leave the rest to you. Safe travels.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to refine another Resistance weapon? Then we will have need of more aetherial siltstone.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: After your last foray, I trust you know where best to search out the antiquities required, so I will say no more. The node will be ready and waiting for your return.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Unable to initiate aetherial siltstone extraction. Please insert artifacts.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Weapon not found. <blip> Please relinquish weapon to proceed with enhancement.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Please insert raw materials to begin aetherial siltstone extraction.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Scanning...
<blip> <blip> Aetherial siltstone detected. Please insert weapon.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Weapon detected. Preparing aetheroinsulation coating.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon aether stabilized. <blip> Please select memories for desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By supplying the Allagan node with timeworn artifacts, you may raise the four available attributes of your Resistance weapon as you see fit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Scanning registry... Readying memories for extraction...

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Applying aetheroinsulation coating...
<blip> <blip> Initiating aetheric memory infusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be damned. It worked!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll give the Allagan ball o' bolts credit─any smith worth their hammer'd be proud of a weapon as fine as this. I'll call 'em'er [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll give the Allagan ball o' bolts credit─any smith worth their hammer'd be proud of a weapon as fine as this. I'll call 'er [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And what better to partner 'er with than [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course if somethin' ain't right with 'emit, tell it to the node, not me.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Warning. <blip> Warning.
Subsequent memory infusions require reapplication of aetheroinsulation coating.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Meaning Blade Surname would need to acquire more siltstone.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: And there is no better place to procure said siltstone than Rowena's House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Our stalls are stocked with the finest relics, containing high concentrations of aetherial siltstone, which are certain to meet all your weapon forging needs. Visit your nearest House of Splendors representative today, and receive a discount on your first purchase!
If quality is what you seek, then come to Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
This advertisement was brought to you by Rowena's House of Splendors.
The House of Splendors is not responsible for damages, injury, or painful
death incurred through the use, misuse, or inability to use their products.
Offer is void in the void where prohibited or not prohibited.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hell... Is nothing safe from that money-grubbin' witch?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Guess I should count meself fortunate. 'Least I got to keep me name, unlike the rest o' her bloody underlings. <sigh> Though I reckon she'll come fer that too afore long...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, lasslad─if somethin' ain't right with 'emit, tell it to the node, not me.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Additional aetherial siltstone required for reapplication of aetheroinsulation coating. Artifacts from Rowena's House of Splendors recommended for maximum efficiency. <blip> House of Splendors representatives are standing by!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hmm... That would certainly save you from the undue burden of traveling the world over in search of the requisite antiquities. Of course, that is to say nothing of the payment expected in return...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: From what I gather, placing ourselves in their debt, financial or otherwise, would be ill-advised.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Aetherial sealant can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

quest.name: 真の「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Before the finishing touches can be added to the Resistance weapon, Zlatan has one last task for you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

As Zlatan explains it, the raw emotions you seek were first discovered at the site of intense battles where emotions ran high. He asks that you seek out equally fierce confrontations to find fifteen crystals of raw emotion.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada in Zadnor, any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

You return to Gangos with the required raw emotions, and it is not long before the familiar clangor of Gerolt's hammer and the whirring of the Allagan node fills the air. Before long, the work is completed, and you find yourself the proud owner of a weapon the ancient Bozjans could only dream of, possessed of a strength that may very well rival that of Save the Queen. Zlatan wastes no time relaying the good news to Bajsaljen.

Interrupting the jubilant mood, Regana brings up the matter of their contract, claiming Rowena has doubled the asking price for the materials used in the forging of such weapons. To everyone's surprise, Rowena herself appears unexpectedly to refute those selfsame claims and thereby uncover Regana's extortion scheme. Her plans exposed, Regana fully expects her employment to be terminated, but Zlatan insists she stays on to fulfill the contract between the Resistance and the House of Splendors. Rowena consents to his request, and all present, save perhaps Gerolt, are pleased to see that their work will be allowed to continue.

Your work to perfect the Resistance weapon has enheartened Bajsaljen, for now the people of Bozja will at last have a shining beacon of hope under which they might rally.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: This new variety of crystals was first discovered on the plateaus of Zadnor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Much like the memories of the dying, we believe these crystals manifested from pitched battle with the enemy where emotions ran high.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For a warrior of your prowess, I can only assume this means you must seek out perilous battles with the most deadly of foes to stir such emotions. We believe that fifteen of these crystallized emotions should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Seeking to refine another Resistance weapon, I see. Thankfully, there are still resources left over from the last weapon, though we will require another assortment of raw emotions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need fifteen to see our work done.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by undertaking the duties Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask where exactly you plan to procure the emotions we require, but I pray that you will return to us safely, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Blade Surname. If you have obtained a suitable store of raw emotions, let us commence the refining process. Before we begin, might I ask you to unequip your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has made ready the forge, and all the other requisite materials are accounted for. May I see the crystals you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us take these to Master Gerolt. I can scarcely wait to see what wonders he will work with his forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this seems to be everythin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Time to get to work. Why don't you go and tell the node what tickles yer fancy while I start in on the weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of the Allagan node, Regana, a sealant was required when we last made use of it. Will we not have need of more?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Yes, a sealant made with aetherial siltstone is still required to complete the refining process.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: However, when making adjustments to the node and testing the enhanced coating process, there was a surprising amount of sealant left unused. There should be enough for now, but if Forename should be inclined to refine other weapons, we will need to acquire more.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's awful kind o' ye. Maybe you ain't such a skinflint after all.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, it is in everyone's best interests to see these weapons perfected. And if the House of Splendors is to establish good relations with the Resistance, a constant cutthroat approach to business will get us nowhere.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That don't sound like the House o' Splendors I know, but if you've a mind to throw the Resistance a bone, who am I to argue?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, let's get to it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And you needn't worry about the aetherial sealant─I have already seen to its preparation. It is the least I can do after my previous transgressions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That is incredibly generous of you, Regana. Thank you.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, well... Generosity aside, there are material concerns that must be addressed if our work is to continue. Should you wish to make further alterations to the weapon, I'm afraid you will have to supply your own sealant.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon receptacle ready for aetheroinsulation coating application. Please select desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may raise four attributes associated with your Resistance weapon as you see fit. When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, that'll do. And that Allagan node did a mighty fine job on the finishin' touches.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A weapon truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A blade truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er twin, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The queen's inscription ain't never shined so bright as when I hammered them crystals into the Resistance weapon. Can scarcely imagine what went into the makin' o' Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' come face-to-face with Her Majesty yerself, I suppose you'd know better than any of us how potent the power o' memory an' emotions can be, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' now that selfsame power is coursin' through yer Resistance weapon. I reckon even Queen Gunnhildr herself'd be hard-pressed to draw any more power out o' them inscriptions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The way you describe it, one might think this Resistance weapon rivals the strength of Save the Queen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, Zlatan! That she might!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wha... What did you just call me?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Surely I'm not the only one who heard that. My actual name... Oh, I pray this is not merely a fleeting moment of sobriety.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's his name!? I s'pose it was only a matter a time afore I got it right...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But anyway, let's not get carried away with celebratin' just yet. We still have to share the fruits of our labor with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Yes, of course! I will go and inform him at once.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And I will see our contract to its conclusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I swear, if me kettles shined half as bright as these Resistance weapons, me debts'd be paid in no time at all.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt, I would rather you refrained from drawing comparisons between the legacy of my forebears and...kettles, no matter how shiny they may be.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Just a bit o' humor to keep the mood light, nothin' to get worked up about Laz─er, lad.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No harm done, Master Gerolt. If no offense was meant, then none shall be taken.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I fear he hasn't realized Gerolt has already forgotten his name.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Thank you for using the House of Splendor's weapon refinement services. <blip> <blip>
We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.
